alicloud-datasource-images.body:
data "alicloud_images" "$1" {
    # name_regex - (Optional) A regex string to apply to the image list returned by Alicloud.
    name_regex = ""

    # most_recent - (Optional) If more than one result is returned, use the most recent image.
    most_recent = ""

    # owners - (Optional) Limit search to specific image owners. Valid items are `system`, `self`, `others`, `marketplace`.
    owners = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - ID of the image.
    # "architecture" - Platform type of the image system:i386 | x86_64.
    # "creation_time" - Time of creation.
    # "description" - Description of the image.
    # "image_owner_alias" - Alias of the image owner.
    # "os_name" - Display name of the OS.
    # "status" - Status of the image, with possible values: "UnAvailable", "Available", "Creating" or "CreateFailed".
    # "size" - Size of the image.
    # "disk_device_mappings" - Description of the system with disks and snapshots under an image.
    # "device" - Device information of the created disk: such as /dev/xvdb.
    # "size" - Size of the created disk.
    # "snapshot_id" - Snapshot ID.
    # "product_code" - Product code of the image on the image market.
    # "is_subscribed" - Whether the user has subscribed to the terms of service for the image product corresponding to the ProductCode.
    # "image_version" - Version of the image.
    # "progress" - Progress of image creation, presented in percentages.
}
alicloud-datasource-images.description: The Images data source list image resource list contains private images of the user and images of system resources provided by Alicloud, as well as other public images and those available on the image market.

alicloud-datasource-instance-types.body:
data "alicloud_instance_types" "$1" {
    # cpu_core_count - (Optional) Limit search to specific cpu core count.
    cpu_core_count = ""

    # memory_size - (Optional) Limit search to specific memory size.
    memory_size = ""

    # instance_type_family - (Optional) Allows to filter list of Instance Types based on their
    instance_type_family = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - ID of the instance type.
    # "cpu_core_count" - Number of CPU cores.
    # "memory_size" - Size of memory, measured in GB.
    # "family" - The instance type family.
}
alicloud-datasource-instance-types.description: The Instance Types data source list the ecs_instance_types of Alicloud.

alicloud-datasource-regions.body:
data "alicloud_regions" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The full name of the region to select.
    name = ""

    # current - (Optional) Set to true to match only the region configured in the provider.
    current = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - ID of the region.
    # "local_name" - Name of the region in the local language.
}
alicloud-datasource-regions.description: The Regions data source allows access to the list of Alicloud Regions.

alicloud-datasource-zones.body:
data "alicloud_zones" "$1" {
    # available_instance_type - (Optional) Limit search to specific instance type.
    available_instance_type = ""

    # available_resource_creation - (Optional) Limit search to specific resource type. The following values are allowed `Instance`, `Disk` and `VSwitch`.
    available_resource_creation = ""

    # available_disk_category - (Optional) Limit search to specific disk category. Can be either `cloud`, `ephemeral`, or `ephemeral_ssd`.
    available_disk_category = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - ID of the zone.
    # "local_name" - Name of the zone in the local language.
    # "available_instance_types" - Instance types allowed.
    # "available_resource_creation" - Type of resource that can be created.
    # "available_disk_categories" - Set of supported disk categories.
}
alicloud-datasource-zones.description: The Zones data source allows access to the list of Alicloud Zones which can be accessed by an Alicloud account within the region configured in the provider.

alicloud-resource-db-instance.body:
resource "alicloud_db_instance" "$1" {
    # db_instance_storage - (Required) User-defined storage space. Value range: 
    db_instance_storage = ""

    # db_instance_class - (Required) Instance type. For details, see [Instance type table](https://intl.aliyun.com/help/doc-detail/26312.htm?spm=a3c0i.o26228en.a3.2.bRUHF3).
    db_instance_class = ""

    # engine_version - (Required) Database version. Value options: 
    engine_version = ""

    # engine - (Required) Database type. Value options: MySQL, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, and PPAS.
    engine = ""

    # instance_charge_type - (Optional) Valid values are `Prepaid`, `Postpaid`, The default is `Postpaid`.
    instance_charge_type = ""

    # period - (Optional) The time that you have bought the resource, in month. Only valid when instance_charge_type is set as `PrePaid`. Value range [1, 12].
    period = ""

    # zone_id - (Optional) Selected zone to create database instance. You cannot set the ZoneId parameter if the MultiAZ parameter is set to true.
    zone_id = ""

    # multi_az - (Optional) Specifies if the database instance is a multiple Availability Zone deployment.
    multi_az = ""

    # db_instance_net_type - (Optional) Network connection type of an instance. Internet: public network; Intranet: private network
    db_instance_net_type = ""

    # allocate_public_connection - (Optional) If set to true will applies for an Internet connection string of an instance.
    allocate_public_connection = ""

    # instance_network_type - (Optional) VPC: VPC instance; Classic: classic instance. If no value is specified, a classic instance will be created by default.
    instance_network_type = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) The virtual switch ID to launch in VPC. If you want to create instances in VPC network, this parameter must be set.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # master_user_name - (Optional) The master user name for the database instance. Operation account requiring a uniqueness check. It may consist of lower case letters, numbers and underlines, and must start with a letter and have no more than 16 characters.
    master_user_name = ""

    # master_user_password - (Optional) The master password for the database instance. Operation password. It may consist of letters, digits, or underlines, with a length of 6 to 32 characters.
    master_user_password = ""

    # preferred_backup_period - (Optional) Backup period. Values: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.
    preferred_backup_period = ""

    # preferred_backup_time - (Optional) Backup time, in the format ofHH:mmZ- HH:mm Z.
    preferred_backup_time = ""

    # backup_retention_period - (Optional) Retention days of the backup (7 to 730 days). The default value is 7 days.
    backup_retention_period = ""

    # security_ips - (Optional) List of IP addresses under the IP address white list array. The list contains up to 1,000 IP addresses, separated by commas. Supported formats include 0.0.0.0/0, 10.23.12.24 (IP), and 10.23.12.24/24 (Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) mode. /24 represents the length of the prefix in an IP address. The range of the prefix length is [1,32]).
    security_ips = ""

    # db_mappings - (Optional) Database mappings to attach to db instance. See [Block database](#block-database) below for details.
    db_mappings = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The RDS instance ID.
    # "instance_charge_type" - The instance charge type.
    # "period" - The time that you have bought the resource.
    # "engine" - Database type.
    # "engine_version" - The database engine version.
    # "db_instance_class" - The RDS instance class.
    # "db_instance_storage" - The amount of allocated storage.
    # "port" - The database port.
    # "zone_id" - The zone ID of the DB instance.
    # "db_instance_net_type" - Network connection type of an instance, "Internet" or "Intranet".
    # "instance_network_type" - The instance network type and it has two values: "vpc" and "classic".
    # "db_mappings" - Database mappings attached to db instance.
    # "preferred_backup_period" - Backup period.
    # "preferred_backup_time" - Backup time.
    # "backup_retention_period" - Retention days of the backup.
    # "security_ips" - Security ips of instance whitelist.
    # "connections" - Views all the connection information of a specified instance.
}
alicloud-resource-db-instance.description:
Provides an RDS instance resource.  A DB instance is an isolated database
environment in the cloud.  A DB instance can contain multiple user-created
databases.

alicloud-resource-disk.body:
resource "alicloud_disk" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) The size of the disk in GiBs, and its value depends on `Category`. `cloud` disk value range: 5GB ~ 2000GB and other category disk value range: 20 ~ 32768.
    size = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The Zone to create the disk in.
    availability_zone = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the ECS disk. This name can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the disk. This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters, It cannot begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    description = ""

    # category - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Category of the disk. Valid values are `cloud`, `cloud_efficiency` and `cloud_ssd`. Default is `cloud`.
    category = ""

    # snapshot_id - (Optional) A snapshot to base the disk off of. If it is specified, `size` will be invalid and the disk size is equals to the snapshot size.
    snapshot_id = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The disk ID.
    # "availability_zone" - The Zone to create the disk in.
    # "name" - The disk name.
    # "description" - The disk description.
    # "status" - The disk status.
    # "category" - The disk category.
    # "size" - The disk size.
    # "snapshot_id" - The disk snapshot ID.
    # "tags" - The disk tags.
}
alicloud-resource-disk.description: Provides a ECS disk resource. ~> **NOTE:** One of `size` or `snapshot_id` is required when specifying an ECS disk. If all of them be specified, `size` must more than the size of snapshot which `snapshot_id` represents. Currently, `alicloud_disk` doesn't resize disk.

alicloud-resource-disk-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_disk_attachment" "$1" {
    # instance_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) ID of the Instance to attach to.
    instance_id = ""

    # disk_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) ID of the Disk to be attached.
    disk_id = ""

    # device_name - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The device name to expose to the instance (for example, /dev/xvdb).
    device_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "instance_id" - ID of the Instance.
    # "disk_id" - ID of the Disk.
    # "device_name" - The device name exposed to the instance.
}
alicloud-resource-disk-attachment.description: Provides an Alicloud ECS Disk Attachment as a resource, to attach and detach disks from ECS Instances.

alicloud-resource-eip.body:
resource "alicloud_eip" "$1" {
    # bandwidth - (Optional) Maximum bandwidth to the elastic public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). If this value is not specified, then automatically sets it to 5 Mbps.
    bandwidth = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Internet charge type of the EIP, Valid values are `PayByBandwidth`, `PayByTraffic`. Default is `PayByBandwidth`.
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The EIP ID.
    # "bandwidth" - The elastic public network bandwidth.
    # "internet_charge_type" - The EIP internet charge type.
    # "status" - The EIP current status.
    # "ip_address" - The elastic ip address
    # "instance" - The ID of the instance which is associated with the EIP.
}

alicloud-resource-eip-association.body:
resource "alicloud_eip_association" "$1" {
    # allocation_id - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The allocation EIP ID.
    allocation_id = ""

    # instance_id - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The ID of the instance.
    instance_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "allocation_id" - As above.
    # "instance_id" - As above.
}
alicloud-resource-eip-association.description:
Provides an Alicloud EIP Association resource, to associate and disassociate Elastic IPs from ECS Instances. ~> **NOTE:** `alicloud_eip_association` is useful in scenarios where EIPs are either
 pre-existing or distributed to customers or users and therefore cannot be changed.
 In addition, it only supports ECS-VPC.

alicloud-resource-ess-scaling-configurat.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_scaling_configuration" "$1" {
    # security_group_id - (Required) ID of the security group to which a newly created instance belongs.
    security_group_id = ""

    # io_optimized - (Required) Valid values are `none`, `optimized`, If `optimized`, the launched ECS instance will be I/O optimized.
    io_optimized = ""

    # instance_type - (Required) Resource type of an ECS instance.
    instance_type = ""

    # image_id - (Required) ID of an image file, indicating the image resource selected when an instance is enabled.
    image_id = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Required) ID of the scaling group of a scaling configuration.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # scaling_configuration_name - (Optional) Name shown for the scheduled task. If this parameter value is not specified, the default value is ScalingConfigurationId.
    scaling_configuration_name = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) Network billing type, Values: PayByBandwidth or PayByTraffic. If this parameter value is not specified, the default value is PayByBandwidth.
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # internet_max_bandwidth_in - (Optional) Maximum incoming bandwidth from the public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). The value range is [1,200].
    internet_max_bandwidth_in = ""

    # internet_max_bandwidth_out - (Optional) Maximum outgoing bandwidth from the public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). The value range for PayByBandwidth is [1,100].
    internet_max_bandwidth_out = ""

    # system_disk_category - (Optional) Category of the system disk. The parameter value options are cloud and ephemeral. 
    system_disk_category = ""

    # data_disk - (Optional) DataDisk mappings to attach to ecs instance. See [Block datadisk](#block-datadisk) below for details. 
    data_disk = ""

    # instance_ids - (Optional) ID of the ECS instance to be attached to the scaling group after it is enabled. You can input up to 20 IDs. 
    instance_ids = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The scaling configuration ID.
    # "active" - Wether the current scaling configuration is actived.
    # "image_id" - The ecs instance Image id.
    # "instance_type" - The ecs instance type.
    # "io_optimized" - The ecs instance whether I/O optimized.
    # "security_group_id" - ID of the security group to which a newly created instance belongs.
    # "scaling_configuration_name" - Name of scaling configuration.
    # "internet_charge_type" - Internet charge type of ecs instance.
}
alicloud-resource-ess-scaling-configurat.description: Provides a ESS scaling configuration resource.

alicloud-resource-ess-scaling-group.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_scaling_group" "$1" {
    # max_size - (Required) Maximum number of ECS instances in the scaling group. Value range: [0, 100].
    max_size = ""

    # min_size - (Required) Minimum number of ECS instances in the scaling group. Value range: [0, 100].
    min_size = ""

    # scaling_group_name - (Optional) Name shown for the scaling group, which must contain 2-40 characters (English or Chinese). If this parameter is not specified, the default value is ScalingGroupId.
    scaling_group_name = ""

    # default_cooldown - (Optional) Default cool-down time (in seconds) of the scaling group. Value range: [0, 86400]. The default value is 300s.
    default_cooldown = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) The virtual switch ID which the ecs instance to be create in.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # removal_policies - (Optional) RemovalPolicy is used to select the ECS instances you want to remove from the scaling group when multiple candidates for removal exist. Optional values:
    removal_policies = ""

    # db_instance_ids - (Optional) If an RDS instance is specified in the scaling group, the scaling group automatically attaches the Intranet IP addresses of its ECS instances to the RDS access whitelist.
    db_instance_ids = ""

    # loadbalancer_ids - (Optional) If a Server Load Balancer instance is specified in the scaling group, the scaling group automatically attaches its ECS instances to the Server Load Balancer instance.
    loadbalancer_ids = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The scaling group ID.
    # "min_size" - The minimum number of ECS instances.
    # "max_size" - The maximum number of ECS instances.
    # "scaling_group_name" - The name of the scaling group.
    # "default_cooldown" - The default cool-down of the scaling group.
    # "removal_policies" - The removal policy used to select the ECS instance to remove from the scaling group.
    # "db_instance_ids" - The db instance id which the ECS instance attached to.
    # "loadbalancer_ids" - The slb instance id which the ECS instance attached to.
}
alicloud-resource-ess-scaling-group.description: Provides a ESS scaling group resource.

alicloud-resource-ess-scaling-rule.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_scaling_rule" "$1" {
    # adjustment_value - (Required) Adjusted value of a scaling rule. Value range:
    adjustment_value = ""

    # adjustment_type - (Required) Adjustment mode of a scaling rule. Optional values:
    adjustment_type = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Required) ID of the scaling group of a scaling rule.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # scaling_rule_name - (Optional) Name shown for the scaling rule, which is a string containing 2 to 40 English or Chinese characters.
    scaling_rule_name = ""

    # cooldown - (Optional) Cool-down time of a scaling rule. Value range: [0, 86,400], in seconds. The default value is empty.
    cooldown = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The scaling rule ID.
    # "scaling_group_id" - The id of scaling group.
    # "ari" - Unique identifier of a scaling rule.
    # "adjustment_type" - Adjustment mode of a scaling rule.
    # "adjustment_value" - Adjustment value of a scaling rule.
    # "scaling_rule_name" - Name of a scaling rule.
    # "cooldown" - Cool-down time of a scaling rule.
}
alicloud-resource-ess-scaling-rule.description: Provides a ESS scaling rule resource.

alicloud-resource-ess-schedule.body:
resource "alicloud_ess_schedule" "$1" {
    # launch_time - (Required) Operations performed when the scheduled task is triggered. Fill in the unique identifier of the scaling rule.
    launch_time = ""

    # scheduled_action - (Required) Operations performed when the scheduled task is triggered. Fill in the unique identifier of the scaling rule.
    scheduled_action = ""

    # scheduled_task_name - (Optional) Display name of the scheduled task, which must be 2-40 characters (English or Chinese) long.
    scheduled_task_name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the scheduled task, which is 2-200 characters (English or Chinese) long.
    description = ""

    # launch_expiration_time - (Optional) Time period within which the failed scheduled task is retried. The default value is 600s. Value range: [0, 21600]
    launch_expiration_time = ""

    # recurrence_type - (Optional) Type of the scheduled task to be repeated. RecurrenceType, RecurrenceValue and RecurrenceEndTime must be specified. Optional values:
    recurrence_type = ""

    # recurrence_value - (Optional) Value of the scheduled task to be repeated. RecurrenceType, RecurrenceValue and RecurrenceEndTime must be specified.
    recurrence_value = ""

    # recurrence_end_time - (Optional) End time of the scheduled task to be repeated. The date format follows the ISO8601 standard and uses UTC time. It is in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ. A time point 90 days after creation or modification cannot be entered. RecurrenceType, RecurrenceValue and RecurrenceEndTime must be specified.                                  
    recurrence_end_time = ""

    # task_enabled - (Optional) Whether to enable the scheduled task. The default value is true.
    task_enabled = ""

    # id - (Optional) The schedule task ID.
    id = ""

    # scheduled_action - (Optional) The action of schedule task.
    scheduled_action = ""

    # launch_time - (Optional) The time of schedule task be triggered.
    launch_time = ""

    # scheduled_task_name - (Optional) The name of schedule task.
    scheduled_task_name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of schedule task.
    description = ""

    # task_enabled - (Optional) Wether the task is enabled.
    task_enabled = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

alicloud-resource-instance.body:
resource "alicloud_instance" "$1" {
    # security_groups - (Required)  A list of security group ids to associate with.
    security_groups = ""

    # io_optimized - (Required) Valid values are `none`, `optimized`, If `optimized`, the launched ECS instance will be I/O optimized.
    io_optimized = ""

    # instance_type - (Required) The type of instance to start.
    instance_type = ""

    # image_id - (Required) The Image to use for the instance. ECS instance's image can be replaced via changing 'image_id'.
    image_id = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) The Zone to start the instance in.
    availability_zone = ""

    # instance_name - (Optional) The name of the ECS. This instance_name can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://. If not specified, 
    instance_name = ""

    # allocate_public_ip - (Optional) Associate a public ip address with an instance in a VPC or Classic. Boolean value, Default is false.
    allocate_public_ip = ""

    # system_disk_category - (Optional) Valid values are `cloud`, `cloud_efficiency`, `cloud_ssd`, For I/O optimized instance type, `cloud_ssd` and `cloud_efficiency` disks are supported. For non I/O Optimized instance type, `cloud` disk are supported. 
    system_disk_category = ""

    # system_disk_size - (Optional) Size of the system disk, value range: 40GB ~ 500GB. Default is 40GB. ECS instance's system disk can be reset when replacing system disk.
    system_disk_size = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the instance, This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters, It cannot begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.
    description = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) Internet charge type of the instance, Valid values are `PayByBandwidth`, `PayByTraffic`. Default is `PayByBandwidth`.
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # internet_max_bandwidth_in - (Optional) Maximum incoming bandwidth from the public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). Value range: [1, 200]. If this value is not specified, then automatically sets it to 200 Mbps.
    internet_max_bandwidth_in = ""

    # internet_max_bandwidth_out - (Optional) Maximum outgoing bandwidth to the public network, measured in Mbps (Mega bit per second). Value range:  [0, 100], If this value is not specified, then automatically sets it to 0 Mbps.
    internet_max_bandwidth_out = ""

    # host_name - (Optional) Host name of the ECS, which is a string of at least two characters. “hostname” cannot start or end with “.” or “-“. In addition, two or more consecutive “.” or “-“ symbols are not allowed. On Windows, the host name can contain a maximum of 15 characters, which can be a combination of uppercase/lowercase letters, numerals, and “-“. The host name cannot contain dots (“.”) or contain only numeric characters.
    host_name = ""

    # password - (Optional) Password to an instance is a string of 8 to 30 characters. It must contain uppercase/lowercase letters and numerals, but cannot contain special symbols. In order to take effect new password, the instance will be restarted after modifying the password.
    password = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) The virtual switch ID to launch in VPC. If you want to create instances in VPC network, this parameter must be set.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # instance_charge_type - (Optional) Valid values are `PrePaid`, `PostPaid`, The default is `PostPaid`.
    instance_charge_type = ""

    # period - (Optional) The time that you have bought the resource, in month. Only valid when instance_charge_type is set as `PrePaid`. Value range [1, 12].
    period = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.
    user_data = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The instance ID.
    # "availability_zone" - The Zone to start the instance in.
    # "instance_name" - The instance name.
    # "host_name" - The instance host name.
    # "description" - The instance description.
    # "status" - The instance status.
    # "image_id" - The instance Image Id.
    # "instance_type" - The instance type.
    # "instance_network_type" - The instance network type and it has two values: "vpc" and "classic".
    # "io_optimized" - The instance whether I/O optimized.
    # "private_ip" - The instance private ip.
    # "public_ip" - The instance public ip.
    # "vswitch_id" - If the instance created in VPC, then this value is  virtual switch ID.
    # "tags" - The instance tags, use jsonencode(item) to display the value.
}

alicloud-resource-nat-gateway.body:
resource "alicloud_nat_gateway" "$1" {
    # bandwidth_packages - (Required) A list of bandwidth packages for the nat gatway.
    bandwidth_packages = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces New Resorce) The VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # spec - (Optional) (Required, Forces New Resorce) The specification of the nat gateway. Valid values are `Small`, `Middle` and `Large`. Details refer to [Nat Gateway Specification](https://help.aliyun.com/document_detail/42757.html?spm=5176.doc32322.6.559.kFNBzv)
    spec = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the nat gateway. The value can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-",".","_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the nat gateway, This description can have a string of 2 to 256 characters, It cannot begin with http:// or https://. Defaults to null.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the nat gateway.
    # "name" - The name of the nat gateway.
    # "description" - The description of the nat gateway.
    # "spec" - The specification of the nat gateway.
    # "vpc_id" - The VPC ID for the nat gateway.
    # "bandwidth_package_ids" - A list ID of the bandwidth packages, and split them with commas
    # "snat_table_ids" - The nat gateway will auto create a snap and forward item, the "snat_table_ids" is the created one.
    # "forward_table_ids" - The nat gateway will auto create a snap and forward item, the "forward_table_ids" is the created one.
}
alicloud-resource-nat-gateway.description: Provides a resource to create a VPC NAT Gateway. ~> **NOTE:** alicloud_nat_gateway must depends on alicloud_vswitch.

alicloud-resource-route-entry.body:
resource "alicloud_route_entry" "$1" {
    # router_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The ID of the virtual router attached to Vpc.
    router_id = ""

    # route_table_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The ID of the route table.
    route_table_id = ""

    # destination_cidrblock - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The RouteEntry's target network segment.
    destination_cidrblock = ""

    # nexthop_type - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available value is Instance.
    nexthop_type = ""

    # nexthop_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop.
    nexthop_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "router_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The ID of the virtual router attached to Vpc.
    # "route_table_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The ID of the route table.
    # "destination_cidrblock" - (Required, Forces new resource) The RouteEntry's target network segment.
    # "nexthop_type" - (Required, Forces new resource) The next hop type. Available value is Instance.
    # "nexthop_id" - (Required, Forces new resource) The route entry's next hop.
}

alicloud-resource-security-group.body:
resource "alicloud_security_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the security group. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The security group description. Defaults to null.
    description = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the security group
    # "vpc_id" - The VPC ID.
    # "name" - The name of the security group
    # "description" - The description of the security group
}
alicloud-resource-security-group.description: Provides a security group resource. ~> **NOTE:** `alicloud_security_group` is used to build and manage a security group, and `alicloud_security_group_rule` can define ingress or egress rules for it.

alicloud-resource-security-group-rule.body:
resource "alicloud_security_group_rule" "$1" {
    # security_group_id - (Required) The security group to apply this rule to.
    security_group_id = ""

    # port_range - (Required) The range of port numbers relevant to the IP protocol. When the protocol is tcp or udp, the default port number range is 1-65535. For example, `1/200` means that the range of the port numbers is 1-200.
    port_range = ""

    # ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol. Can be `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp`, `gre` or `all`.
    ip_protocol = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of rule being created. Valid options are `ingress` (inbound) or `egress` (outbound).
    type = ""

    # nic_type - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Network type, can be either `internet` or `intranet`, the default value is `internet`.
    nic_type = ""

    # policy - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Authorization policy, can be either `accept` or `drop`, the default value is `accept`.
    policy = ""

    # priority - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Authorization policy priority, with parameter values: `1-100`, default value: 1.
    priority = ""

    # cidr_ip - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The target IP address range. The default value is 0.0.0.0/0 (which means no restriction will be applied). Other supported formats include 10.159.6.18/12. Only IPv4 is supported.
    cidr_ip = ""

    # source_security_group_id - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The target security group ID within the same region. Either the `source_security_group_id` or `cidr_ip` must be set. If both are set, then `cidr_ip` is authorized by default. If this field is specified, but no `cidr_ip` is specified, the `nic_type` can only select `intranet`.
    source_security_group_id = ""

    # source_group_owner_account - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The Alibaba Cloud user account Id of the target security group when security groups are authorized across accounts.  This parameter is invalid if `cidr_ip` has already been set.
    source_group_owner_account = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the security group rule
    # "type" - The type of rule, "ingress" or "egress"
    # "name" - The name of the security group
    # "port_range" - The range of port numbers
    # "ip_protocol" - The protocol of the security group rule
}
alicloud-resource-security-group-rule.description:
Provides a security group rule resource.
Represents a single `ingress` or `egress` group rule, which can be added to external Security Groups. ~> **NOTE:**  `nic_type` should set to `intranet` when security group type is `vpc`. In this situation it does not distinguish between intranet and internet, the rule is effective on them both.

alicloud-resource-slb.body:
resource "alicloud_slb" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the SLB. This name must be unique within your AliCloud account, can have a maximum of 80 characters,
    name = ""

    # internet - (Optional) (Optional, Forces New Resource) If true, the SLB addressType will be internet, false will be intranet, Default is false. If load balancer launched in VPC, this value must be "false".
    internet = ""

    # internet_charge_type - (Optional) (Optional, Forces New Resource) Valid
    internet_charge_type = ""

    # bandwidth - (Optional) Valid
    bandwidth = ""

    # listener - (Optional) Additional SLB listener. See [Block listener](#block-listener) below for details.
    listener = ""

    # vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required for a VPC SLB, Forces New Resource) The VSwitch ID to launch in.
    vswitch_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the load balancer.
    # "name" - The name of the load balancer.
    # "internet" - The internet of the load balancer.
    # "internet_charge_type" - The internet_charge_type of the load balancer.
    # "bandwidth" - The bandwidth of the load balancer.
    # "vswitch_id" - The VSwitch ID of the load balancer. Only available on SLB launched in a VPC.
    # "address" - The IP address of the load balancer.
}
alicloud-resource-slb.description: Provides an Application Load Balancer resource.

alicloud-resource-slb-attachment.body:
resource "alicloud_slb_attachment" "$1" {
    # instances - (Required) A list of instance ids to added backend server in the SLB. If dettachment instances then this value set [].
    instances = ""

    # slb_id - (Required) The ID of the SLB..
    slb_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "backend_servers" - The backend servers of the load balancer.
}
alicloud-resource-slb-attachment.description: Provides an Application Load Balancer Attachment resource.

alicloud-resource-vpc.body:
resource "alicloud_snat_entry" "$1" {
    # snat_ip - (Required) The SNAT ip address, the ip must along bandwidth package public ip which `alicloud_nat_gateway` argument `bandwidth_packages`.
    snat_ip = ""

    # snat_table_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The value can get from `alicloud_nat_gateway` Attributes "snat_table_ids".
    snat_table_id = ""

    # source_vswitch_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The vswitch ID.
    source_vswitch_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

alicloud-resource-vswitch.body:
resource "alicloud_vswitch" "$1" {
    # availability_zone - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The AZ for the switch.
    availability_zone = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # cidr_block - (Optional) (Required, Forces new resource) The CIDR block for the switch.
    cidr_block = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the switch. Defaults to null.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The switch description. Defaults to null.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the switch.
    # "availability_zone" The AZ for the switch.
    # "cidr_block" - The CIDR block for the switch.
    # "vpc_id" - The VPC ID.
    # "name" - The name of the switch.
    # "description" - The description of the switch.
}

archive-datasource-archive-file.body:
data "archive_file" "$1" {
    # filename - (Required) Set this as the filename when declaring a `source`.
    filename = ""

    # content - (Required) Add this content to the archive with `filename` as the filename.
    content = ""

    # output_path - (Required) The output of the archive file.
    output_path = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of archive to generate. NOTE: `zip` is supported.
    type = ""

    # source_content - (Optional) Add only this content to the archive with `source_content_filename` as the filename.
    source_content = ""

    # source_content_filename - (Optional) Set this as the filename when using `source_content`.
    source_content_filename = ""

    # source_file - (Optional) Package this file into the archive.
    source_file = ""

    # source_dir - (Optional) Package entire contents of this directory into the archive.
    source_dir = ""

    # source - (Optional) Specifies attributes of a single source file to include into the archive.
    source = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "output_size" - The size of the output archive file.
    # "output_sha" - The SHA1 checksum of output archive file.
    # "output_base64sha256" - The base64-encoded SHA256 checksum of output archive file.
    # "output_md5" - The MD5 checksum of output archive file.
}
archive-datasource-archive-file.description: Generates an archive from content, a file, or directory of files.

arukas-resource-container.body:
resource "container" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, string) The name of the container.
    name = ""

    # image - (Optional) (Required, string) The ID of the image to back this container.It must be a public image on DockerHub.
    image = ""

    # instances - (Optional) (Optional, int) The count of the instance. It must be between `1` and `10`.
    instances = ""

    # memory - (Optional) (Optional, int) The size of the instance RAM.It must be `256` or `512`.
    memory = ""

    # endpoint - (Optional) (Optional,string) The subdomain part of the endpoint assigned by Arukas. If it is not set, Arukas will do automatic assignment.
    endpoint = ""

    # ports - (Optional) (Required , block) See [Ports](#ports) below for details.
    ports = ""

    # environments - (Optional) (Required , block) See [Environments](#environments) below for details.
    environments = ""

    # cmd - (Optional) (Optional , string) The command of the container.
    cmd = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the container.
    # "app_id" - The ID of the Arukas application to which the container belongs.
    # "name" - The name of the container.
    # "image" - The ID of the image to back this container.
    # "instances" - The count of the instance.
    # "memory" - The size of the instance RAM.
    # "endpoint" - The subdomain part of the endpoint assigned by Arukas.
    # "ports" - See [Ports](#ports) below for details.
    # "environments" - See [Environments](#environments) below for details.
    # "cmd" - The command of the container.
    # "port_mappings" - See [PortMappings](#port_mappings) below for details.
    # "endpoint_full_url" - The URL of endpoint.
    # "endpoint_full_hostname" - The Hostname of endpoint.
}
arukas-resource-container.description: Provides container resource. This allows container to be created, updated and deleted. For additional details please refer to [API documentation](https://arukas.io/en/documents-en/arukas-api-reference-en/#containers).

azure-affinity-group.body:
resource "azure_affinity_group" "$1" {
    # label - (Required) A label to be used for tracking purposes.
    label = ""

    # location - (Required) The location where the affinity group should be created.   For a list of all Azure locations, please consult [this link](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/).
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the affinity group. Must be unique on your   Azure subscription.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for the affinity group.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The affinity group ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "description" - (Optional) A description for the affinity group.
}
azure-affinity-group.description: Creates a new affinity group on Azure.

azure-hosted-service.body:
resource "azure_hosted_service" "$1" {
    # ephemeral_contents - (Required) A boolean value (true|false), specifying   whether all the resources present in the hosted hosted service should be   destroyed following the hosted service's destruction.
    ephemeral_contents = ""

    # location - (Required) The location where the hosted service should be created.   For a list of all Azure locations, please consult [this link](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/).
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the hosted service. Must be unique on Azure.
    name = ""

    # reverse_dns_fqdn - (Optional) The reverse of the fully qualified domain name   for the hosted service.
    reverse_dns_fqdn = ""

    # label - (Optional) A label to be used for tracking purposes. Must be   non-void. Defaults to `Made by Terraform.`.
    label = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for the hosted service.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The hosted service ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "description" - (Optional) A description for the hosted service.
}
azure-hosted-service.description: Creates a new hosted service on Azure with its own .cloudapp.net domain.

azure-resource-data-disk.body:
resource "azure_data_disk" "$1" {
    # virtual_machine - (Required) The name of the virtual machine the disk will   be attached to.
    virtual_machine = ""

    # lun - (Required) The Logical Unit Number (LUN) for the disk. The LUN   specifies the slot in which the data drive appears when mounted for usage   by the virtual machine. Valid LUN values are 0 through 31.
    lun = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of an existing registered disk to attach to the   virtual machine. If left empty, a new empty disk will be created and   attached instead. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # label - (Optional) The identifier of the data disk. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created (defaults to "virtual_machine-lun")
    label = ""

    # size - (Optional) The size, in GB, of an empty disk to be attached to the   virtual machine. Required when creating a new disk, not used otherwise.
    size = ""

    # caching - (Optional) The caching behavior of data disk. Valid options are:   `None`, `ReadOnly` and `ReadWrite` (defaults `None`)
    caching = ""

    # storage_service_name - (Optional) The name of an existing storage account   within the subscription which will be used to store the VHD of this disk.   Required if no value is supplied for `media_link`. Changing this forces   a new resource to be created.
    storage_service_name = ""

    # media_link - (Optional) The location of the blob in storage where the VHD   of this disk will be created. The storage account where must be associated   with the subscription. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    media_link = ""

    # source_media_link - (Optional) The location of a blob in storage where a   VHD file is located that is imported and registered as a disk. If a value   is supplied, `media_link` will not be used.
    source_media_link = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The security group ID.
    # "virtual_machine" - (Required) The name of the virtual machine the disk will   be attached to.
    # "name" - The name of the disk.
    # "virtual_machine" - (Required) The name of the virtual machine the disk will   be attached to.
    # "label" - The identifier for the disk.
    # "virtual_machine" - (Required) The name of the virtual machine the disk will   be attached to.
    # "media_link" - The location of the blob in storage where the VHD of this disk
    # "virtual_machine" - (Required) The name of the virtual machine the disk will   be attached to.
}
azure-resource-data-disk.description:
Adds a data disk to a virtual machine. If the name of an existing disk is given,
it will attach that disk. Otherwise it will create and attach a new empty disk.

azure-resource-dns-server.body:
resource "azure_dns_server" "$1" {
    # dns_address - (Required) The IP address of the DNS server.
    dns_address = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the DNS server reference. Changing this   forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The DNS server definition ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "dns_address" - (Required) The IP address of the DNS server.
}
azure-resource-dns-server.description: Creates a new DNS server definition to be used internally in Azure.

azure-resource-instance.body:
resource "azure_instance" "$1" {
    # private_port - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
    private_port = ""

    # public_port - (Required) The external port to use for the endpoint.
    public_port = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the external endpoint.
    name = ""

    # username - (Required) The username of a new user that will be created while   creating the instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    username = ""

    # location - (Required) The location/region where the cloud service is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # size - (Required) The size of the instance.
    size = ""

    # image - (Required) The name of an existing VM or OS image to use for this   instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    image = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the instance. Changing this forces a new   resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # hosted_service_name - (Optional) The name of the hosted service the   instance should be deployed under. If not provided; it will default to the   value of `name`. Changes to this parameter forces the creation of a new   resource.
    hosted_service_name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description for the associated hosted service.   Changing this forces a new resource to be created (defaults to the instance   name).
    description = ""

    # subnet - (Optional) The name of the subnet to connect this instance to. If   a value is supplied `virtual_network` is required. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    subnet = ""

    # virtual_network - (Optional) The name of the virtual network the `subnet`   belongs to. If a value is supplied `subnet` is required. Changing this   forces a new resource to be created.
    virtual_network = ""

    # storage_service_name - (Optional) The name of an existing storage account   within the subscription which will be used to store the VHDs of this   instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. **A Storage   Service is required if you are using a Platform Image**
    storage_service_name = ""

    # reverse_dns - (Optional) The DNS address to which the IP address of the   hosted service resolves when queried using a reverse DNS query. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    reverse_dns = ""

    # automatic_updates - (Optional) If true this will enable automatic updates.   This attribute is only used when creating a Windows instance. Changing this   forces a new resource to be created (defaults false)
    automatic_updates = ""

    # time_zone - (Optional) The appropriate time zone for this instance in the   format 'America/Los_Angeles'. This attribute is only used when creating a   Windows instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created   (defaults false)
    time_zone = ""

    # password - (Optional) The password of the new user that will be created   while creating the instance. Required when creating a Windows instance or   when not supplying an `ssh_key_thumbprint` while creating a Linux instance.   Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    password = ""

    # ssh_key_thumbprint - (Optional) The SSH thumbprint of an existing SSH key   within the subscription. This attribute is only used when creating a Linux   instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    ssh_key_thumbprint = ""

    # security_group - (Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with   this instance.
    security_group = ""

    # endpoint - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to define multiple   endpoints. Each `endpoint` block supports fields documented below.
    endpoint = ""

    # domain_name - (Optional) The name of an Active Directory domain to join.
    domain_name = ""

    # domain_ou - (Optional) Specifies the LDAP Organizational Unit to place the   instance in.
    domain_ou = ""

    # domain_username - (Optional) The username of an account with permission to   join the instance to the domain. Required if a domain_name is specified.
    domain_username = ""

    # domain_password - (Optional) The password for the domain_username account   specified above.
    domain_password = ""

    # custom_data - (Optional) The custom data to provide when launching the   instance.
    custom_data = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) The transport protocol for the endpoint. Valid   options are: `tcp` and `udp` (defaults `tcp`)
    protocol = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The instance ID.
    # "private_port" - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
    # "description" - The description for the associated hosted service.
    # "private_port" - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
    # "subnet" - The subnet the instance is connected to.
    # "private_port" - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
    # "endpoint" - The complete set of configured endpoints.
    # "private_port" - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
    # "security_group" - The associated Network Security Group.
    # "private_port" - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
    # "ip_address" - The private IP address assigned to the instance.
    # "private_port" - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
    # "vip_address" - The public IP address assigned to the instance.
    # "private_port" - (Required) The private port on which the instance is   listening.
}
azure-resource-instance.description:
Creates a hosted service, role and deployment and then creates a virtual
machine in the deployment based on the specified configuration.

azure-resource-local-network-connection.body:
resource "azure_local_network_connection" "$1" {
    # address_space_prefixes - (Required) List of address spaces accessible   through the VPN connection. The elements are in the CIDR format.
    address_space_prefixes = ""

    # vpn_gateway_address - (Required) The public IPv4 of the VPN endpoint.
    vpn_gateway_address = ""

    # name - (Required) The name by which this local network connection will   be referenced by. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The local network connection ID.
    # "address_space_prefixes" - (Required) List of address spaces accessible   through the VPN connection. The elements are in the CIDR format.
}
azure-resource-local-network-connection.description: Defines a new connection to a remote network through a VPN tunnel.

azure-resource-security-group.body:
resource "azure_security_group" "$1" {
    # location - (Required) The location/region where the security group is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the security group. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # label - (Optional) The identifier for the security group. The label can be   up to 1024 characters long. Changing this forces a new resource to be   created (defaults to the security group name)
    label = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The security group ID.
    # "location" - (Required) The location/region where the security group is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    # "label" - The identifier for the security group.
    # "location" - (Required) The location/region where the security group is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
}
azure-resource-security-group.description:
Creates a new network security group within the context of the specified
subscription.

azure-resource-security-group-rule.body:
resource "azure_security_group_rule" "$1" {
    # destination_port_range - (Required) The destination port or range. This value   can be between 0 and 65535. An asterisk (\*) can also be used to match all   ports.
    destination_port_range = ""

    # destination_address_prefix - (Required) The address prefix of packet   destinations that should be subjected to the rule. An asterisk   (\*) can also be used to match all destination IPs.
    destination_address_prefix = ""

    # source_port_range - (Required) The source port or range. This value can be   between 0 and 65535. An asterisk (\*) can also be used to match all ports.
    source_port_range = ""

    # source_address_prefix - (Required) The address prefix of packet sources that   that should be subjected to the rule. An asterisk (\*) can also be used to   match all source IPs.
    source_address_prefix = ""

    # priority - (Required) The priority of the network security rule. Rules with   lower priority are evaluated first. This value can be between 100 and 4096.
    priority = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of the security rule. Valid options are:   `Inbound` and `Outbound`.
    type = ""

    # security_group_names - (Required) A list of the names of the security groups   the rule should be applied to.   Changing this list forces the creation of a new resource.
    security_group_names = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the security group rule.
    name = ""

    # action - (Optional) The action that is performed when the security rule is   matched. Valid options are: `Allow` and `Deny`.
    action = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) The protocol of the security rule. Valid options are:   `TCP`, `UDP` and `*`.
    protocol = ""

    # id - (Optional) The security group rule ID. Coincides with its given `name`.
    id = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) The protocol of the security rule. Valid options are:   `TCP`, `UDP` and `*`.
    protocol = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
azure-resource-security-group-rule.description:
Creates a new network Security Group Rule to be associated with a number of
given Security Groups. ~> **NOTE on Security Group Rules**: for usability purposes; Terraform allows the
addition of a single Security Group Rule to multiple Security Groups, despite
it having to define each rule individually per Security Group on Azure. As a
result; in the event that one of the Rules on one of the Groups is modified by
external factors, Terraform cannot reason as to whether or not that change
should be propagated to the others; let alone choose one changed Rule
configuration over another in case of a conflic. As such; `terraform refresh`
only checks that the rule is still defined for each of the specified
`security_group_names`; ignoring the actual parameters of the Rule and **not**
updating the state with regards to them.

azure-resource-virtual-network.body:
resource "azure_virtual_network" "$1" {
    # address_prefix - (Required) The address prefix to use for the subnet.
    address_prefix = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the subnet.
    name = ""

    # subnet - (Required) Can be specified multiple times to define multiple   subnets. Each `subnet` block supports fields documented below.
    subnet = ""

    # location - (Required) The location/region where the virtual network is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # address_space - (Required) The address space that is used the virtual   network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces   a new resource to be created.
    address_space = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # dns_servers - (Optional) List of names of DNS servers previously registered   on Azure.
    dns_servers = ""

    # security_group - (Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with   the subnet.
    security_group = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The virtual NetworkConfiguration ID.
    # "security_group" - (Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with   the subnet.
}
azure-resource-virtual-network.description:
Creates a new virtual network including any configured subnets. Each subnet can
optionally be configured with a security group to be associated with the subnet.

azure-sql-database-server.body:
resource "azure_sql_database_server" "$1" {
    # password - (Required) The password for the administrator of the database server.
    password = ""

    # username - (Required) The username for the administrator of the database server.
    username = ""

    # location - (Required) The location where the database server should be created.   For a list of all Azure locations, please consult [this link](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/).
    location = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Computed) The name of the database server. It is determined upon   creation as it is randomly-generated per server.
    name = ""

    # version - (Optional) The version of the database server to be used. Can be any   one of `2.0` or `12.0`.
    version = ""

    # url - (Optional) (Computed) The fully qualified domain name of the database server.   Will be of the form `<name>.database.windows.net`.
    url = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The database server ID. Coincides with the randomly-generated "name".
    # "url" - (Computed) The fully qualified domain name of the database server.   Will be of the form "<name>.database.windows.net".
}
azure-sql-database-server.description: Allocates a new SQL Database Server on Azure.

azure-sql-database-server-firewall-rule.body:
resource "azure_sql_database_server_firewall_rule" "$1" {
    # database_server_names - (Required) The set of names of the Azure SQL   Database servers the rule should be enforced on.
    database_server_names = ""

    # end_ip - (Required) The IPv4 which will represent the upper bound of the   rule's application IP's. Traffic to/from IP's lesser that or equal to this   one all the way down to the `start_ip` will be permitted.
    end_ip = ""

    # start_ip - (Required) The IPv4 which will represent the lower bound of the   rule's application IP's. Traffic to/from IP's greater than or equal to this   one up to the `end_ip` will be permitted.
    start_ip = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the rule. Changing forces the creation of a   new resource.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The database server ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "database_server_names" - (Required) The set of names of the Azure SQL   Database servers the rule should be enforced on.
}
azure-sql-database-server-firewall-rule.description: Defines a new Firewall Rule to be applied across the given Database Servers.

azure-sql-database-service.body:
resource "azure_sql_database_service" "$1" {
    # database_server_name - (Required) The name of the database server this service   should run on. Changes here force the creation of a new resource.
    database_server_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the database service.
    name = ""

    # edition - (Optional) The edition of the database service. For more information   on each variant, please view [this](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn741340.aspx) link.
    edition = ""

    # collation - (Optional) The collation to be used within the database service.   Defaults to the standard Latin charset.
    collation = ""

    # max_size_bytes - (Optional) The maximum size in bytes the database service   should be allowed to expand to. Range depends on the database `edition`   selected above.
    max_size_bytes = ""

    # service_level_id - (Optional) The ID corresponding to the service level per   edition. Please refer to [this](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn505701.aspx) link for more details.
    service_level_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The database service ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "service_level_id" - (Optional) The ID corresponding to the service level per   edition. Please refer to [this](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn505701.aspx) link for more details.
}
azure-sql-database-service.description: Creates a new SQL database service on an Azure database server.

azure-storage-blob.body:
resource "azure_storage_blob" "$1" {
    # type - (Required) The type of the storage blob to be created. One of either   `BlockBlob` or `PageBlob`.
    type = ""

    # storage_container_name - (Required) The name of the storage container   in which this blob should be created. Must be located on the storage   service given with `storage_service_name`.
    storage_container_name = ""

    # storage_service_name - (Required) The name of the storage service within   which the storage container in which the blob will be created resides.
    storage_service_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the storage blob. Must be unique within   the storage service the blob is located.
    name = ""

    # size - (Optional) Used only for `PageBlob`'s to specify the size in bytes   of the blob to be created. Must be a multiple of 512. Defaults to 0.
    size = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The storage blob ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "size" - (Optional) Used only for "PageBlob"'s to specify the size in bytes   of the blob to be created. Must be a multiple of 512. Defaults to 0.
}
azure-storage-blob.description: Creates a new storage blob within a given storage container on Azure.

azure-storage-container.body:
resource "azure_storage_container" "$1" {
    # container_access_type - (Required) The 'interface' for access the container   provides. Can be either `blob`, `container` or ``.
    container_access_type = ""

    # storage_service_name - (Required) The name of the storage service within   which the storage container should be created.
    storage_service_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the storage container. Must be unique within   the storage service the container is located.
    name = ""

    # properties - (Optional) Key-value definition of additional properties   associated to the storage service.
    properties = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The storage container ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "properties" - (Optional) Key-value definition of additional properties   associated to the storage service.
}
azure-storage-container.description: Creates a new storage container within a given storage service on Azure.

azure-storage-queue.body:
resource "azure_storage_queue" "$1" {
    # storage_service_name - (Required) The name of the storage service within   which the storage queue should be created.
    storage_service_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the storage queue. Must be unique within   the storage service the queue is located.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The storage queue ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "storage_service_name" - (Required) The name of the storage service within   which the storage queue should be created.
}
azure-storage-queue.description: Creates a new storage queue within a given storage service on Azure.

azure-storage-service.body:
resource "azure_storage_service" "$1" {
    # account_type - (Required) The type of storage account to be created.   Available options include `Standard_LRS`, `Standard_ZRS`, `Standard_GRS`,   `Standard_RAGRS` and `Premium_LRS`. To learn more about the differences   of each storage account type, please consult [this link](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2013/12/11/introducing-read-access-geo-replicated-storage-ra-grs-for-windows-azure-storage.aspx).
    account_type = ""

    # location - (Required) The location where the storage service should be created.   For a list of all Azure locations, please consult [this link](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/).
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the storage service. Must be between 4 and 24   lowercase-only characters or digits. Must be unique on Azure.
    name = ""

    # affinity_group - (Optional) The affinity group the storage service should   belong to.
    affinity_group = ""

    # properties - (Optional) Key-value definition of additional properties   associated to the storage service. For additional information on what   these properties do, please consult [this link](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh452235.aspx).
    properties = ""

    # label - (Optional) A label to be used for tracking purposes. Must be   non-void. Defaults to `Made by Terraform.`.
    label = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for the storage service.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The storage service ID. Coincides with the given "name".
    # "description" - (Optional) A description for the storage service.
}
azure-storage-service.description: Creates a new storage service on Azure in which storage containers may be created.

azurerm-datasource-builtin-role-definiti.body:
data "azurerm_builtin_role_definition" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the built-in Role Definition. Possible values are: `Contributor`, `Owner`, `Reader` and `VirtualMachineContributor`.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the ID of the built-in Role Definition.
    # "description" - the Description of the built-in Role.
    # "type" - the Type of the Role.
    # "permissions" - a "permissions" block as documented below.
    # "assignable_scopes" - One or more assignable scopes for this Role Definition, such as "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333", "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup", or "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/myVM".
    # "actions" - a list of actions supported by this role
    # "not_actions" - a list of actions which are denied by this role
}
azurerm-datasource-builtin-role-definiti.description: Use this data source to access the properties of a built-in Role Definition. To access information about a custom Role Definition, [please see the `azurerm_role_definition` data source](role_definition.html) instead.

azurerm-datasource-client-config.body:
data "azurerm_client_config" "$1" {
    # Exported Attributes
    # "client_id" is set to the Azure Client ID (Application Object ID).
    # "tenant_id" is set to the Azure Tenant ID.
    # "subscription_id" is set to the Azure Subscription ID.
    # "service_principal_application_id" is the Service Principal Application ID.
    # "service_principal_object_id" is the Service Principal Object ID.
}
azurerm-datasource-client-config.description:
Use this data source to access the configuration of the Azure Resource Manager
provider.

azurerm-datasource-image.body:
data "azurerm_image" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) The Name of the Resource Group where this Image exists.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Image.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "location" - the Azure Location where this Image exists.
    # "os_disk" - a "os_disk" block as defined below.
    # "data_disk" - a collection of "data_disk" blocks as defined below.
    # "tags" - a mapping of tags to assigned to the resource.
    # "os_disk" supports the following:
    # "blob_uri" - the URI in Azure storage of the blob used to create the image.
    # "caching" - the caching mode for the OS Disk, such as "ReadWrite", "ReadOnly", or "None".
    # "managed_disk_id" - the ID of the Managed Disk used as the OS Disk Image.
    # "os_state" - the State of the OS used in the Image, such as "Generalized".
    # "os_type" - the type of Operating System used on the OS Disk. such as "Linux" or "Windows".
    # "size_gb" - the size of the OS Disk in GB.
    # "data_disk" supports the following:
    # "blob_uri" - the URI in Azure storage of the blob used to create the image.
    # "caching" - the caching mode for the Data Disk, such as "ReadWrite", "ReadOnly", or "None".
    # "lun" - the logical unit number of the data disk.
    # "managed_disk_id" - the ID of the Managed Disk used as the Data Disk Image.
    # "size_gb" - the size of this Data Disk in GB.
}
azurerm-datasource-image.description: Use this data source to access information about an Image.

azurerm-datasource-key-vault-access-poli.body:
data "azurerm_key_vault_access_policy" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Management Tempalte. Possible values are: `Key Management`,
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the ID of the Key Vault Access Policy
    # "key_permissions" - the key permissions for the access policy
    # "secret_permissions" - the secret permissions for the access policy
    # "certificate_permissions" - the certificate permissions for the access policy
}
azurerm-datasource-key-vault-access-poli.description: Use this data source to access information about the permissions from the Management Key Vault Templates.

azurerm-datasource-managed-disk.body:
data "azurerm_managed_disk" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Managed Disk.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "storage_account_type" - The storage account type for the managed disk.
    # "source_uri" - The source URI for the managed disk
    # "source_resource_id" - ID of an existing managed disk that the current resource was created from.
    # "os_type" - The operating system for managed disk. Valid values are "Linux" or "Windows"
    # "disk_size_gb" - The size of the managed disk in gigabytes.
    # "tags" - A mapping of tags assigned to the resource.
}
azurerm-datasource-managed-disk.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an existing Azure Managed Disk.

azurerm-datasource-platform-image.body:
data "azurerm_platform_image" "$1" {
    # sku - (Required) Specifies the SKU of the Platform Image.
    sku = ""

    # offer - (Required) Specifies the Offer associated with the Platform Image.
    offer = ""

    # publisher - (Required) Specifies the Publisher associated with the Platform Image.
    publisher = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the Location to pull information about this Platform Image from.
    location = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Platform Image.
    # "version" - The latest version of the Platform Image.
}
azurerm-datasource-platform-image.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure Platform Image.

azurerm-datasource-public-ip.body:
data "azurerm_public_ip" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the public IP address.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "domain_name_label" - The label for the Domain Name.
    # "idle_timeout_in_minutes" - Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection.
    # "fqdn" - Fully qualified domain name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.
    # "ip_address" - The IP address value that was allocated.
    # "tags" - A mapping of tags to assigned to the resource.
}
azurerm-datasource-public-ip.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an existing Azure Public IP Address.

azurerm-datasource-resource-group.body:
data "azurerm_resource_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "location" - The location of the resource group.
    # "tags" - A mapping of tags assigned to the resource group.
}
azurerm-datasource-resource-group.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure resource group.

azurerm-datasource-role-definition.body:
data "azurerm_role_definition" "$1" {
    # scope - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    scope = ""

    # role_definition_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the Role Definition as a UUID/GUID.
    role_definition_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the ID of the built-in Role Definition.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "description" - the Description of the built-in Role.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "type" - the Type of the Role.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "permissions" - a "permissions" block as documented below.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "assignable_scopes" - One or more assignable scopes for this Role Definition, such as "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333", "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup", or "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/myVM".
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "actions" - a list of actions supported by this role
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "not_actions" - a list of actions which are denied by this role
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
}
azurerm-datasource-role-definition.description: Use this data source to access the properties of a custom Role Definition. To access information about a built-in Role Definition, [please see the `azurerm_builtin_role_definition` data source](builtin_role_definition.html) instead.

azurerm-datasource-snapshot.body:
data "azurerm_snapshot" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group the Snapshot is located in.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Snapshot.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Snapshot.
    # "create_option" - How the snapshot was created.
    # "source_uri" - The URI to a Managed or Unmanaged Disk.
    # "source_resource_id" - The reference to an existing snapshot.
    # "storage_account_id" - The ID of an storage account.
    # "disk_size_gb" - The size of the Snapshotted Disk in GB.
}
azurerm-datasource-snapshot.description: Use this data source to access the properties of a Snapshot of an Disk.

azurerm-datasource-subnet.body:
data "azurerm_subnet" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group the Virtual Network is located in.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # virtual_network_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Virtual Network this Subnet is located within.
    virtual_network_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Subnet.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Subnet.
    # "address_prefix" - The address prefix used for the subnet.
    # "network_security_group_id" - The ID of the Network Security Group associated with the subnet.
    # "route_table_id" - The ID of the Route Table associated with this subnet.
    # "ip_configurations" - The collection of IP Configurations with IPs within this subnet.
}
azurerm-datasource-subnet.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure Subnet located within a Virtual Network.

azurerm-datasource-subscription.body:
data "azurerm_subscription" "$1" {
    # subscription_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the subscription. If this argument is omitted, the subscription ID of the current Azure Resource Manager provider is used.
    subscription_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "display_name" - The subscription display name.
    # "state" - The subscription state. Possible values are Enabled, Warned, PastDue, Disabled, and Deleted.
    # "location_placement_id" - The subscription location placement ID.
    # "quota_id" - The subscription quota ID.
    # "spending_limit" - The subscription spending limit.
}
azurerm-datasource-subscription.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure subscription.

azurerm-resource-app-service-plan.body:
resource "azurerm_app_service_plan" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) Specifies the plan's instance size.
    size = ""

    # tier - (Required) Specifies the plan's pricing tier.
    tier = ""

    # sku - (Required) A `sku` block as documented below.
    sku = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the App Service Plan component.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the App Service Plan component. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # kind - (Optional) The kind of the App Service Plan to create. Possible values are `Windows` and `Linux`. Defaults to `Windows`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    kind = ""

    # properties - (Optional) A `properties` block as documented below.
    properties = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # sku - (Optional) `sku` supports the following:
    sku = ""

    # capacity - (Optional) Specifies the number of workers associated with this App Service Plan.
    capacity = ""

    # properties - (Optional) `properties` supports the following:
    properties = ""

    # maximum_number_of_workers - (Optional) Maximum number of instances that can be assigned to this App Service plan.
    maximum_number_of_workers = ""

    # reserved - (Optional) Is this App Service Plan `Reserved`. Defaults to `false`.
    reserved = ""

    # per_site_scaling - (Optional) Can Apps assigned to this App Service Plan be scaled independently? If set to `false` apps assigned to this plan will scale to all instances of the plan.  Defaults to `false`.
    per_site_scaling = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the App Service Plan component.
    # "per_site_scaling" - (Optional) Can Apps assigned to this App Service Plan be scaled independently? If set to "false" apps assigned to this plan will scale to all instances of the plan.  Defaults to "false".
    # "maximum_number_of_workers" - The maximum number of workers supported with the App Service Plan's sku.
    # "per_site_scaling" - (Optional) Can Apps assigned to this App Service Plan be scaled independently? If set to "false" apps assigned to this plan will scale to all instances of the plan.  Defaults to "false".
}
