azurerm-resource-app-service-plan.description: Create an App Service Plan component.

azurerm-resource-app-service-x.body:
resource "azurerm_app_service" "$1" {
    # value - (Required) The value for the Connection String.
    value = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of the Connection String. Possible values are `APIHub`, `Custom`, `DocDb`, `EventHub`, `MySQL`, `NotificationHub`, `PostgreSQL`, `RedisCache`, `ServiceBus`, `SQLAzure` and  `SQLServer`.
    type = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Connection String.
    name = ""

    # app_service_plan_id - (Required) The ID of the App Service Plan within which to create this App Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    app_service_plan_id = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the App Service Plan component.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the App Service Plan component. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # app_settings - (Optional) A key-value pair of App Settings.
    app_settings = ""

    # connection_string - (Optional) An `connection_string` block as defined below.
    connection_string = ""

    # client_affinity_enabled - (Optional) Should the App Service send session affinity cookies, which route client requests in the same session to the same instance? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    client_affinity_enabled = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Is the App Service Enabled? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    enabled = ""

    # site_config - (Optional) A `site_config` object as defined below.
    site_config = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    tags = ""

    # connection_string - (Optional) `connection_string` supports the following:
    connection_string = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    tags = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    tags = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    tags = ""

    # site_config - (Optional) `site_config` supports the following:
    site_config = ""

    # always_on - (Optional) Should the app be loaded at all times? Defaults to `false`.
    always_on = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    tags = ""

    # default_documents - (Optional) The ordering of default documents to load, if an address isn't specified.
    default_documents = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    tags = ""

    # dotnet_framework_version - (Optional) The version of the .net framework's CLR used in this App Service. Possible values are `v2.0` (which will use the latest version of the .net framework for the .net CLR v2 - currently `.net 3.5`) and `v4.0` (which corresponds to the latest version of the .net CLR v4 - which at the time of writing is `.net 4.7.1`). [For more information on which .net CLR version to use based on the .net framework you're targetting - please see this table](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.NET_Framework_version_history#Overview). Defaults to `v4.0`.
    dotnet_framework_version = ""

    # java_version - (Optional) The version of Java to use. If specified `java_container` and `java_container_version` must also be specified. Possible values are `1.7` and `1.8`.
    java_version = ""

    # java_container - (Optional) The Java Container to use. If specified `java_version` and `java_container_version` must also be specified. Possible values are `JETTY` and `TOMCAT`.
    java_container = ""

    # java_version - (Optional) The version of Java to use. If specified `java_container` and `java_container_version` must also be specified. Possible values are `1.7` and `1.8`.
    java_version = ""

    # java_container_version - (Optional) The version of the Java Container to use. If specified `java_version` and `java_container` must also be specified.
    java_container_version = ""

    # local_mysql_enabled - (Optional) Is "MySQL In App" Enabled? This runs a local MySQL instance with your app and shares resources from the App Service plan.
    local_mysql_enabled = ""

    # managed_pipeline_mode - (Optional) The Managed Pipeline Mode. Possible values are `Integrated` and `Classic`. Defaults to `Integrated`.
    managed_pipeline_mode = ""

    # local_mysql_enabled - (Optional) Is "MySQL In App" Enabled? This runs a local MySQL instance with your app and shares resources from the App Service plan.
    local_mysql_enabled = ""

    # name - (Required) User defined name for a url path map.
    name = ""

    # http_listener_name - (Required) Reference to `http_listener`.

    # name - (Required) User defined name for a request routing rule.
    name = ""

    name = ""

    # capacity - (Required) Specifies instance count. Can be 1 to 10.
    capacity = ""

    # tier - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard`
    tier = ""

    # tier - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard`
    tier = ""

    # tier - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard`
    tier = ""

    # name - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard_Small`
    name = ""

    # name - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard_Small`
    name = ""

    # name - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard_Small`
    name = ""

    # name - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard_Small`
    name = ""

    # name - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard_Small`
    name = ""

    # name - (Required) Supported values are: `Standard_Small`
    name = ""

    # request_routing_rule - (Required) Request routing rules can be either Basic or Path Based.  Request routing rules are order sensitive.  The `request_routing_rule` block supports fields documented below.
    request_routing_rule = ""

    # http_listener - (Required) 1 or more listeners specifying port, http or https and SSL certificate (if configuring SSL offload)  Each `http_listener` is attached to a `frontend_ip_configuration`.  The `http_listener` block supports fields documented below.
    http_listener = ""

    # backend_http_settings - (Required) Related group of backend http and/or https features to be applied when routing to backend address pools.  The `backend_http_settings` block supports fields documented below.
    backend_http_settings = ""

    # backend_address_pool - (Required) Backend pools can be composed of NICs, virtual machine scale sets, public IPs, internal IPs, fully qualified domain names (FQDN), and multi-tenant back-ends like Azure Web Apps. Application Gateway backend pool members are not tied to an availability set. Members of backend pools can be across clusters, data centers, or outside of Azure as long as they have IP connectivity.  The `backend_address_pool` block supports fields documented below.
    backend_address_pool = ""

    # frontend_ip_configuration - (Required) Specifies lists of frontend IP configurations. Currently only one Public and/or one Private IP address can be specified. Also one frontendIpConfiguration element can specify either Public or Private IP address, not both.  The `frontend_ip_configuration` block supports fields documented below.
    frontend_ip_configuration = ""

    # frontend_port - (Required) Front-end port for the application gateway.  The `frontend_port` block supports fields documented below.
    frontend_port = ""

    # gateway_ip_configuration - (Required) List of subnets that the application gateway is deployed into.  The application gateway must be deployed into an existing virtual network/subnet.  No other resource can be deployed in a subnet where application gateway is deployed.  The `gateway_ip_configuration` block supports fields documented below.
    gateway_ip_configuration = ""

    # sku - (Required) Specifies size, tier and capacity of the application gateway.  Must be specified once.  The `sku` block fields documented below.
    sku = ""

    # location - (Required) The location/region where the application gateway is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the application gateway.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the application gateway. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # probe - (Optional) Specifies list of URL probes. The `probe` block supports fields documented below.
    probe = ""

    # url_path_map - (Optional) UrlPathMaps give url Path to backend mapping information for PathBasedRouting specified in `request_routing_rule`.  The `url_path_map` block supports fields documented below.
    url_path_map = ""

    # authentication_certificate - (Optional) List of authentication certificates.  The `authentication_certificate` block supports fields documented below.
    authentication_certificate = ""

    # ssl_certificate - (Optional) List of ssl certificates. The `ssl_certificate` block supports fields documented below.
    ssl_certificate = ""

    # waf_configuration - (Optional) Web Application Firewall configuration settings. The `waf_configuration` block supports fields documented below.
    waf_configuration = ""

    # disabled_ssl_protocols - (Optional) based on "sslPolicy": {"disabledSslProtocols": []}
    disabled_ssl_protocols = ""

    # subnet_id - (Optional) Reference to a Subnet.
    subnet_id = ""

    # private_ip_address - (Optional) Private IP Address.
    private_ip_address = ""

    # public_ip_address_id - (Optional) Specifies resource Id of a Public Ip Address resource. IPAllocationMethod should be Dynamic.
    public_ip_address_id = ""

    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Valid values are: `Dynamic`
    private_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Valid values are: `Dynamic`
    private_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Valid values are: `Dynamic`
    private_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # ip_address_list - (Optional) List of public IPAdresses, or internal IP addresses in a backend address pool.
    ip_address_list = ""

    # fqdn_list - (Optional) List of FQDNs in a backend address pool.
    fqdn_list = ""

    # probe_name - (Optional) Reference to URL probe.
    probe_name = ""

    # authentication_certificate - (Optional) this doesn't seem to belong here
    authentication_certificate = ""

    # host_name - (Optional) HostName for `http_listener`. It has to be a valid DNS name.
    host_name = ""

    # ssl_certificate_name - (Optional) Reference to ssl certificate. Valid only if protocol is https.
    ssl_certificate_name = ""

    # require_sni - (Optional) Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting. Valid values are:
    require_sni = ""

    # require_sni - (Optional) Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting. Valid values are:
    require_sni = ""

    # require_sni - (Optional) Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting. Valid values are:
    require_sni = ""

    # backend_address_pool_name - (Optional) Reference to `backend_address_pool_name`. Valid for Basic Rule only.
    backend_address_pool_name = ""

    # backend_http_settings_name - (Optional) Reference to `backend_http_settings`. Valid for Basic Rule only.
    backend_http_settings_name = ""

    # url_path_map_name - (Optional) Reference to `url_path_map`. Valid for PathBasedRouting Rule only.
    url_path_map_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The application gatewayConfiguration ID.
    # "name" - The name of the application gateway.
    # "resource_group_name" - The name of the resource group in which to create the application gateway.
    # "location" - The location/region where the application gateway is created
}
azurerm-resource-application-gateway.description: Creates a new application gateway based on a previously created virtual network with configured subnets.

azurerm-resource-authorization-role-defi.body:
resource "azurerm_role_definition" "$1" {
    # assignable_scopes - (Required) One or more assignable scopes for this Role Definition, such as `/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333`, `/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup`, or `/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/myVM`.
    assignable_scopes = ""

    # permissions - (Required) A `permissions` block as defined below.
    permissions = ""

    # scope - (Required) The scope at which the Role Definition applies too, such as `/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333`, `/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup`, or `/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/myVM`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    scope = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Role Definition. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # role_definition_id - (Required) A unique UUID/GUID which identifies this role. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    role_definition_id = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the Role Definition.
    description = ""

    # action - (Optional) One or more Allowed Actions, such as `*`, `Microsoft.Resources/subscriptions/resourceGroups/read`.
    action = ""

    # not_action - (Optional) One or more Disallowed Actions, such as `*`, `Microsoft.Resources/subscriptions/resourceGroups/read`.
    not_action = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Role Definition ID.
    # "not_action" - (Optional) One or more Disallowed Actions, such as "*", "Microsoft.Resources/subscriptions/resourceGroups/read".
}
azurerm-resource-authorization-role-defi.description: Manages a custom Role Definition, used to assign Roles to Users/Principals.

azurerm-resource-cdn-endpoint.body:
resource "azurerm_cdn_endpoint" "$1" {
    # host_name - (Required) A string that determines the hostname/IP address of the origin server. This string can be a domain name, Storage Account endpoint, Web App endpoint, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.
    host_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the origin. This is an arbitrary value. However, this value needs to be unique under endpoint.
    name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # profile_name - (Required) The CDN Profile to which to attach the CDN Endpoint.
    profile_name = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the CDN Endpoint.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the CDN Endpoint. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # origin_host_header - (Optional) The host header CDN provider will send along with content requests to origins. Defaults to the host name of the origin.
    origin_host_header = ""

    # is_http_allowed - (Optional) Defaults to `true`.
    is_http_allowed = ""

    # is_https_allowed - (Optional) Defaults to `true`.
    is_https_allowed = ""

    # origin - (Optional) The set of origins of the CDN endpoint. When multiple origins exist, the first origin will be used as primary and rest will be used as failover options. Each `origin` block supports fields documented below.
    origin = ""

    # origin_path - (Optional) The path used at for origin requests.
    origin_path = ""

    # querystring_caching_behaviour - (Optional) Sets query string caching behavior. Allowed values are `IgnoreQueryString`, `BypassCaching` and `UseQueryString`. Defaults to `IgnoreQueryString`.
    querystring_caching_behaviour = ""

    # content_types_to_compress - (Optional) An array of strings that indicates a content types on which compression will be applied. The value for the elements should be MIME types.
    content_types_to_compress = ""

    # is_compression_enabled - (Optional) Indicates whether compression is to be enabled. Defaults to false.
    is_compression_enabled = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # http_port - (Optional) The HTTP port of the origin. Defaults to `80`.
    http_port = ""

    # https_port - (Optional) The HTTPS port of the origin. Defaults to `443`.
    https_port = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The CDN Endpoint ID.
    # "https_port" - (Optional) The HTTPS port of the origin. Defaults to "443".
}
azurerm-resource-cdn-endpoint.description: A CDN Endpoint is the entity within a CDN Profile containing configuration information regarding caching behaviors and origins. The CDN Endpoint is exposed using the URL format <endpointname>.azureedge.net by default, but custom domains can also be created.

azurerm-resource-compute-virtualmachine-.body:
resource "azure_virtual_machine_extension" "$1" {
    # settings - (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are   specified as a JSON object in a string.
    settings = ""

    # type_handler_version - (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to   use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.
    type_handler_version = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can   be found using the Azure CLI.
    type = ""

    # publisher - (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers   can be found by using the Azure CLI.
    publisher = ""

    # virtual_machine_name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    virtual_machine_name = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be   created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # location - (Required) The location where the extension is created. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine extension peering. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # auto_upgrade_minor_version - (Optional) Specifies if the platform deploys   the latest minor version update to the `type_handler_version` specified.
    auto_upgrade_minor_version = ""

    # protected_settings - (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the   extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
    protected_settings = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Virtual Machine Extension ID.
    # "protected_settings" - (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the   extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
}
azurerm-resource-compute-virtualmachine-.description:
Creates a new Virtual Machine Extension to provide post deployment configuration
and run automated tasks.

azurerm-resource-compute-virtualmachine-.body:
resource "azurerm_virtual_machine_scale_set" "$1" {
    # product - (Required) Specifies the product of the image from the marketplace.
    product = ""

    # publisher - (Required) Specifies the publisher of the image.
    publisher = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the image from the marketplace.
    name = ""

    # settings - (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
    settings = ""

    # type_handler_version - (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.
    type_handler_version = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can be found using the Azure CLI.
    type = ""

    # publisher - (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers can be found by using the Azure CLI.
    publisher = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the extension.
    name = ""

    # storage_uri - (Required) Blob endpoint for the storage account to hold the virtual machine's diagnostic files. This must be the root of a storage account, and not a storage container.
    storage_uri = ""

    # enabled - (Required) Whether to enable boot diagnostics for the virtual machine.
    enabled = ""

    # lun - (Required) Specifies the Logical Unit Number of the disk in each virtual machine in the scale set.
    lun = ""

    # create_option - (Required) Specifies how the virtual machine should be created. The only possible option is `FromImage`.
    create_option = ""

    # domain_name_label - (Required) The domain name label for the dns settings.
    domain_name_label = ""

    # idle_timeout - (Required) The idle timeout in minutes. This value must be between 4 and 32.
    idle_timeout = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the public ip address configuration
    name = ""

    # subnet_id - (Required) Specifies the identifier of the subnet.
    subnet_id = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies name of the IP configuration.
    name = ""

    # ip_configuration - (Required) An ip_configuration block as documented below
    ip_configuration = ""

    # primary - (Required) Indicates whether network interfaces created from the network interface configuration will be the primary NIC of the VM.
    primary = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the network interface configuration.
    name = ""

    # disable_password_authentication - (Required) Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    disable_password_authentication = ""

    # setting_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies. Possible values are: `FirstLogonCommands` and `AutoLogon`.
    setting_name = ""

    # component - (Required) Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content. The only allowable value is `Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup`.
    component = ""

    # pass - (Required) Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to. The only allowable value is `oobeSystem`.
    pass = ""

    # protocol - (Required) Specifies the protocol of listener
    protocol = ""

    # certificate_url - (Required) It is the Base64 encoding of a JSON Object that which is encoded in UTF-8 of which the contents need to be `data`, `dataType` and `password`.
    certificate_url = ""

    # source_vault_id - (Required) Specifies the key vault to use.
    source_vault_id = ""

    # admin_password - (Required) Specifies the administrator password to use for all the instances of virtual machines in a scale set..
    admin_password = ""

    # admin_username - (Required) Specifies the administrator account name to use for all the instances of virtual machines in the scale set.
    admin_username = ""

    # computer_name_prefix - (Required) Specifies the computer name prefix for all of the virtual machines in the scale set. Computer name prefixes must be 1 to 15 characters long.
    computer_name_prefix = ""

    # capacity - (Required) Specifies the number of virtual machines in the scale set.
    capacity = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the size of virtual machines in a scale set.
    name = ""

    # storage_profile_os_disk - (Required) A storage profile os disk block as documented below
    storage_profile_os_disk = ""

    # network_profile - (Required) A collection of network profile block as documented below.
    network_profile = ""

    # os_profile - (Required) A Virtual Machine OS Profile block as documented below.
    os_profile = ""

    # upgrade_policy_mode - (Required) Specifies the mode of an upgrade to virtual machines in the scale set. Possible values, `Manual` or `Automatic`.
    upgrade_policy_mode = ""

    # sku - (Required) A sku block as documented below.
    sku = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual machine scale set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the virtual machine scale set resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # overprovision - (Optional) Specifies whether the virtual machine scale set should be overprovisioned.
    overprovision = ""

    # single_placement_group - (Optional) Specifies whether the scale set is limited to a single placement group with a maximum size of 100 virtual machines. If set to false, managed disks must be used. Default is true. Changing this forces a
    single_placement_group = ""

    # os_profile_secrets - (Optional) A collection of Secret blocks as documented below.
    os_profile_secrets = ""

    # os_profile_windows_config - (Optional) (Required, when a windows machine) A Windows config block as documented below.
    os_profile_windows_config = ""

    # os_profile_linux_config - (Optional) (Required, when a linux machine) A Linux config block as documented below.
    os_profile_linux_config = ""

    # storage_profile_data_disk - (Optional) A storage profile data disk block as documented below
    storage_profile_data_disk = ""

    # storage_profile_image_reference - (Optional) A storage profile image reference block as documented below.
    storage_profile_image_reference = ""

    # extension - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to add extension profiles to the scale set. Each `extension` block supports the fields documented below.
    extension = ""

    # boot_diagnostics - (Optional) A boot diagnostics profile block as referenced below.
    boot_diagnostics = ""

    # plan - (Optional) A plan block as documented below.
    plan = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # sku - (Optional) `sku` supports the following:
    sku = ""

    # tier - (Optional) Specifies the tier of virtual machines in a scale set. Possible values, `standard` or `basic`.
    tier = ""

    # os_profile - (Optional) `os_profile` supports the following:
    os_profile = ""

    # custom_data - (Optional) Specifies custom data to supply to the machine. On linux-based systems, this can be used as a cloud-init script. On other systems, this will be copied as a file on disk. Internally, Terraform will base64 encode this value before sending it to the API. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    custom_data = ""

    # os_profile_secrets - (Optional) `os_profile_secrets` supports the following:
    os_profile_secrets = ""

    # vault_certificates - (Optional) (Required, on windows machines) A collection of Vault Certificates as documented below
    vault_certificates = ""

    # vault_certificates - (Optional) `vault_certificates` support the following:
    vault_certificates = ""

    # certificate_store - (Optional) (Required, on windows machines) Specifies the certificate store on the Virtual Machine where the certificate should be added to.
    certificate_store = ""

    # os_profile_windows_config - (Optional) `os_profile_windows_config` supports the following:
    os_profile_windows_config = ""

    # provision_vm_agent - (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machines in the scale set.
    provision_vm_agent = ""

    # enable_automatic_upgrades - (Optional) Indicates whether virtual machines in the scale set are enabled for automatic updates.
    enable_automatic_upgrades = ""

    # winrm - (Optional) A collection of WinRM configuration blocks as documented below.
    winrm = ""

    # additional_unattend_config - (Optional) An Additional Unattended Config block as documented below.
    additional_unattend_config = ""

    # winrm - (Optional) `winrm` supports the following:
    winrm = ""

    # certificate_url - (Optional) Specifies URL of the certificate with which new Virtual Machines is provisioned.
    certificate_url = ""

    # additional_unattend_config - (Optional) `additional_unattend_config` supports the following:
    additional_unattend_config = ""

    # content - (Optional) Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.
    content = ""

    # os_profile_linux_config - (Optional) `os_profile_linux_config` supports the following:
    os_profile_linux_config = ""

    # ssh_keys - (Optional) Specifies a collection of `path` and `key_data` to be placed on the virtual machine.
    ssh_keys = ""

    # network_profile - (Optional) `network_profile` supports the following:
    network_profile = ""

    # network_security_group_id - (Optional) Specifies the identifier for the network security group.
    network_security_group_id = ""

    # ip_configuration - (Optional) `ip_configuration` supports the following:
    ip_configuration = ""

    # load_balancer_backend_address_pool_ids - (Optional) Specifies an array of references to backend address pools of load balancers. A scale set can reference backend address pools of one public and one internal load balancer. Multiple scale sets cannot use the same load balancer.
    load_balancer_backend_address_pool_ids = ""

    # load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids - (Optional) Specifies an array of references to inbound NAT rules for load balancers.
    load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids = ""

    # primary - (Optional) Specifies if this ip_configuration is the primary one.
    primary = ""

    # accelerated_networking - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable accelerated networking or not. Defaults to
    accelerated_networking = ""

    # public_ip_address_configuration - (Optional) describes a virtual machines scale set IP Configuration's
    public_ip_address_configuration = ""

    # public_ip_address_configuration - (Optional) `public_ip_address_configuration` supports the following:
    public_ip_address_configuration = ""

    # storage_profile_os_disk - (Optional) `storage_profile_os_disk` supports the following:
    storage_profile_os_disk = ""

    # name - (Optional) Specifies the disk name. Must be specified when using unmanaged disk ('managed_disk_type' property not set).
    name = ""

    # vhd_containers - (Optional) Specifies the vhd uri. Cannot be used when `image` or `managed_disk_type` is specified.
    vhd_containers = ""

    # managed_disk_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Value you must be either `Standard_LRS` or `Premium_LRS`. Cannot be used when `vhd_containers` or `image` is specified.
    managed_disk_type = ""

    # caching - (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: `None` (default), `ReadOnly`, `ReadWrite`.
    caching = ""

    # image - (Optional) Specifies the blob uri for user image. A virtual machine scale set creates an os disk in the same container as the user image.
    image = ""

    # os_type - (Optional) Specifies the operating system Type, valid values are windows, linux.
    os_type = ""

    # storage_profile_data_disk - (Optional) `storage_profile_data_disk` supports the following:
    storage_profile_data_disk = ""

    # create_option - (Optional) Specifies how the data disk should be created. The only possible options are `FromImage` and `Empty`.
    create_option = ""

    # caching - (Optional) Specifies the caching requirements. Possible values include: `None` (default), `ReadOnly`, `ReadWrite`.
    caching = ""

    # disk_size_gb - (Optional) Specifies the size of the disk in GB. This element is required when creating an empty disk.
    disk_size_gb = ""

    # managed_disk_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of managed disk to create. Value must be either `Standard_LRS` or `Premium_LRS`.
    managed_disk_type = ""

    # storage_profile_image_reference - (Optional) `storage_profile_image_reference` supports the following:
    storage_profile_image_reference = ""

    # id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the (custom) image to use to create the virtual
    id = ""

    # publisher - (Optional) Specifies the publisher of the image used to create the virtual machines.
    publisher = ""

    # offer - (Optional) Specifies the offer of the image used to create the virtual machines.
    offer = ""

    # sku - (Optional) Specifies the SKU of the image used to create the virtual machines.
    sku = ""

    # version - (Optional) Specifies the version of the image used to create the virtual machines.
    version = ""

    # boot_diagnostics - (Optional) `boot_diagnostics` supports the following:
    boot_diagnostics = ""

    # extension - (Optional) `extension` supports the following:
    extension = ""

    # auto_upgrade_minor_version - (Optional) Specifies whether or not to use the latest minor version available.
    auto_upgrade_minor_version = ""

    # protected_settings - (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
    protected_settings = ""

    # plan - (Optional) `plan` supports the following:
    plan = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The virtual machine scale set ID.
}
azurerm-resource-compute-virtualmachine-.description:
Create a virtual machine scale set. ~> **Note:** All arguments including the administrator login and password will be stored in the raw state as plain-text.
[Read more about sensitive data in state](/docs/state/sensitive-data.html).

azurerm-resource-container-group.body:
resource "azurerm_container_group" "$1" {
    # share_name - (Required) The Azure storage share that is to be mounted as a volume. This must be created on the storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    share_name = ""

    # storage_account_key - (Required) The access key for the Azure Storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    storage_account_key = ""

    # storage_account_name - (Required) The Azure storage account from which the volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    storage_account_name = ""

    # mount_path - (Required) The path on which this volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    mount_path = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the volume mount. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # memory - (Required) The required memory of the containers in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    memory = ""

    # cpu - (Required) The required number of CPU cores of the containers. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    cpu = ""

    # image - (Required) The container image name. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    image = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # container - (Required) The definition of a container that is part of the group as documented in the `container` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    container = ""

    # os_type - (Required) The OS for the container group. Allowed values are `Linux` and `Windows`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    os_type = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # ip_address_type - (Optional) Specifies the ip address type of the container. `Public` is the only acceptable value at this time. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    ip_address_type = ""

    # port - (Optional) A public port for the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    port = ""

    # environment_variables - (Optional) A list of environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    environment_variables = ""

    # command - (Optional) A command line to be run on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    command = ""

    # volume - (Optional) The definition of a volume mount for this container as documented in the `volume` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    volume = ""

    # read_only - (Optional) Specify if the volume is to be mounted as read only or not. The default value is `false`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    read_only = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The container group ID.
    # "ip_address" - The IP address allocated to the container group.
}
azurerm-resource-container-group.description: Create as an Azure Container Group instance.

azurerm-resource-container-registry.body:
resource "azurerm_container_registry" "$1" {
    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the Container Registry.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Registry. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # admin_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether the admin user is enabled. Defaults to `false`.
    admin_enabled = ""

    # storage_account_id - (Optional) Optional otherwise) The ID of a Storage Account which must be located in the same Azure Region as the Container Registry.
    storage_account_id = ""

    # sku - (Optional) The SKU name of the the container registry. Possible values are `Classic` (which was previously `Basic`), `Basic`, `Standard` and `Premium`.
    sku = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Container Registry ID.
    # "login_server" - The URL that can be used to log into the container registry.
    # "admin_username" - The Username associated with the Container Registry Admin account - if the admin account is enabled.
    # "admin_password" - The Password associated with the Container Registry Admin account - if the admin account is enabled.
}
azurerm-resource-container-registry.description:
Create as an Azure Container Registry instance. ~> **Note:** All arguments including the access key will be stored in the raw state as plain-text.

azurerm-resource-cosmosdb-account.body:
resource "azurerm_cosmosdb_account" "$1" {
    # priority - (Required) The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.
    priority = ""

    # location - (Required) The name of the Azure region to host replicated data.
    location = ""

    # consistency_level - (Required) The Consistency Level to use for this CosmosDB Account - can be either `BoundedStaleness`, `Eventual`, `Session` or `Strong`.
    consistency_level = ""

    # failover_policy - (Required) Specifies a `failover_policy` resource, used to define where data should be replicated.
    failover_policy = ""

    # consistency_policy - (Required) Specifies a `consistency_policy` resource, used to define the consistency policy for this CosmosDB account.
    consistency_policy = ""

    # offer_type - (Required) Specifies the Offer Type to use for this CosmosDB Account - currently this can only be set to `Standard`.
    offer_type = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the CosmosDB Account is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the CosmosDB Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # kind - (Optional) Specifies the Kind of CosmosDB to create - possible values are `GlobalDocumentDB` and `MongoDB`. Defaults to `GlobalDocumentDB`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    kind = ""

    # ip_range_filter - (Optional) CosmosDB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IP's for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.
    ip_range_filter = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # consistency_policy - (Optional) `consistency_policy` supports the following:
    consistency_policy = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # max_interval_in_seconds - (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 - 100. Defaults to `5`. Required when `consistency_level` is set to `BoundedStaleness`.
    max_interval_in_seconds = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # max_staleness - (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 – 2,147,483,647. Defaults to `100`. Required when `consistency_level` is set to `BoundedStaleness`.
    max_staleness = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # failover_policy - (Optional) `failover_policy` supports the following:
    failover_policy = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The CosmosDB Account ID.
    # "primary_master_key" - The Primary master key for the CosmosDB Account.
    # "secondary_master_key" - The Secondary master key for the CosmosDB Account.
    # "primary_readonly_master_key" - The Primary read-only master Key for the CosmosDB Account.
    # "secondary_readonly_master_key" - The Secondary read-only master key for the CosmosDB Account.
}
azurerm-resource-cosmosdb-account.description: Creates a new CosmosDB (formally DocumentDB) Account.

azurerm-resource-database-sql-database.body:
resource "azurerm_sql_database" "$1" {
    # server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server on which to create the database.
    server_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the database.  This must be the same as Database Server resource group currently.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the database.
    name = ""

    # create_mode - (Optional) Specifies the type of database to create. Defaults to `Default`. See below for the accepted values/
    create_mode = ""

    # source_database_id - (Optional) The URI of the source database if `create_mode` value is not `Default`.
    source_database_id = ""

    # restore_point_in_time - (Optional) The point in time for the restore. Only applies if `create_mode` is `PointInTimeRestore` e.g. 2013-11-08T22:00:40Z
    restore_point_in_time = ""

    # edition - (Optional) The edition of the database to be created. Applies only if `create_mode` is `Default`. Valid values are: `Basic`, `Standard`, `Premium`, or `DataWarehouse`. Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    edition = ""

    # collation - (Optional) The name of the collation. Applies only if `create_mode` is `Default`.  Azure default is `SQL_LATIN1_GENERAL_CP1_CI_AS`
    collation = ""

    # max_size_bytes - (Optional) The maximum size that the database can grow to. Applies only if `create_mode` is `Default`.  Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    max_size_bytes = ""

    # requested_service_objective_id - (Optional) Use `requested_service_objective_id` or `requested_service_objective_name` to set the performance level for the database. Valid values are: `S0`, `S1`, `S2`, `S3`, `P1`, `P2`, `P4`, `P6`, `P11` and `ElasticPool`.  Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    requested_service_objective_id = ""

    # requested_service_objective_name - (Optional) Use `requested_service_objective_name` or `requested_service_objective_id` to set the performance level for the database.  Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    requested_service_objective_name = ""

    # source_database_deletion_date - (Optional) The deletion date time of the source database. Only applies to deleted databases where `create_mode` is `PointInTimeRestore`.
    source_database_deletion_date = ""

    # elastic_pool_name - (Optional) The name of the elastic database pool.
    elastic_pool_name = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The SQL Database ID.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "creation_data" - The creation date of the SQL Database.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "default_secondary_location" - The default secondary location of the SQL Database.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
}
azurerm-resource-database-sql-database.description: Allows you to manage an Azure SQL Database

azurerm-resource-database-sql-elasticpoo.body:
resource "azurerm_sql_elasticpool" "$1" {
    # dtu - (Required) The total shared DTU for the elastic pool. Valid values depend on the `edition` which has been defined. Refer to [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/sql-database/sql-database-service-tiers#elastic-pool-service-tiers-and-performance-in-edtus) for valid combinations.
    dtu = ""

    # edition - (Required) The edition of the elastic pool to be created. Valid values are `Basic`, `Standard`, and `Premium`. Refer to [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/sql-database/sql-database-service-tiers#elastic-pool-service-tiers-and-performance-in-edtus) for details. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    edition = ""

    # server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server on which to create the elastic pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    server_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the elastic pool. This must be the same as the resource group of the underlying SQL server.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the elastic pool. This needs to be globally unique. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # db_dtu_min - (Optional) The minimum DTU which will be guaranteed to all databases in the elastic pool to be created.
    db_dtu_min = ""

    # db_dtu_max - (Optional) The maximum DTU which will be guaranteed to all databases in the elastic pool to be created.
    db_dtu_max = ""

    # pool_size - (Optional) The maximum size in MB that all databases in the elastic pool can grow to. The maximum size must be consistent with combination of `edition` and `dtu` and the limits documented in [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/sql-database/sql-database-service-tiers#elastic-pool-service-tiers-and-performance-in-edtus). If not defined when creating an elastic pool, the value is set to the size implied by `edition` and `dtu`.
    pool_size = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The SQL Elastic Pool ID.
    # "creation_date" - The creation date of the SQL Elastic Pool.
}
azurerm-resource-database-sql-elasticpoo.description: Allows you to manage an Azure SQL Elastic Pool.

azurerm-resource-database-sql-server.body:
resource "azurerm_sql_server" "$1" {

    version = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the SQL Server.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server. This needs to be globally unique within Azure.
    name = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The SQL Server ID.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

}
azurerm-resource-database-sql-server.description:
Manages a SQL Azure Database Server. ~> **Note:** All arguments including the administrator login and password will be stored in the raw state as plain-text.
[Read more about sensitive data in state](/docs/state/sensitive-data.html).

    partition_count = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the EventHub's parent Namespace exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # namespace_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the EventHub Namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    namespace_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the EventHub Namespace resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # "id" - The EventHub ID.
    # "partition_ids" - The identifiers for partitions created for Event Hubs.
}
azurerm-resource-eventhub.description: Creates a new Event Hubs as a nested resource within a Event Hubs namespace.

azurerm-resource-eventhub-authorization-.body:
resource "azurerm_eventhub_authorization_rule" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the EventHub Namespace exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # eventhub_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the EventHub. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    eventhub_name = ""

    # namespace_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the grandparent EventHub Namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    namespace_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the EventHub Authorization Rule resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # listen - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Listen to the Event Hub? Defaults to `false`.
    listen = ""

    # send - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Send to the Event Hub? Defaults to `false`.
    send = ""

    # manage - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Manage to the Event Hub? When this property is `true` - both `listen` and `send` must be too. Defaults to `false`.
    manage = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The EventHub ID.
    # "primary_key" - The Primary Key for the Event Hubs authorization Rule.
    # "primary_connection_string" - The Primary Connection String for the Event Hubs authorization Rule.
    # "secondary_key" - The Secondary Key for the Event Hubs authorization Rule.
    # "secondary_connection_string" - The Secondary Connection String for the Event Hubs authorization Rule.
}
azurerm-resource-eventhub-authorization-.description: Creates a new Event Hubs authorization Rule within an Event Hub.

    # key_type - (Required) Specifies the Key Type to use for this Key Vault Key. Possible values are `EC` (Elliptic Curve), `Oct` (Octet), `RSA` and `RSA-HSM`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    key_type = ""

    # vault_uri - (Required) Specifies the URI used to access the Key Vault instance, available on the `azurerm_key_vault` resource.
    vault_uri = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Key Vault Key. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Key Vault Key ID.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "version" - The current version of the Key Vault Key.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "n" - The RSA modulus of this Key Vault Key.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "e" - The RSA public exponent of this Key Vault Key.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
}

azurerm-resource-key-vault-x.body:
resource "azurerm_key_vault" "$1" {
    # secret_permissions - (Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more   from the following: `backup`, `delete`, `get`, `list`, `purge`, `recover`, `restore` and `set`.
    secret_permissions = ""

    # key_permissions - (Required) List of key permissions, must be one or more from   the following: `backup`, `create`, `decrypt`, `delete`, `encrypt`, `get`, `import`, `list`, `purge`, `recover`, `restore`, `sign`, `unwrapKey`, `update`, `verify` and `wrapKey`.
    key_permissions = ""

    # object_id - (Required) The object ID of a user, service principal or security   group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must   be unique for the list of access policies.
    object_id = ""

    # tenant_id - (Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used   for authenticating requests to the key vault. Must match the `tenant_id` used   above.
    tenant_id = ""

    # name - (Required) SKU name to specify whether the key vault is a `standard`
    name = ""

    # access_policy - (Required) An access policy block as described below. At least   one policy is required up to a maximum of 16.
    access_policy = ""

    # tenant_id - (Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be   used for authenticating requests to the key vault.
    tenant_id = ""

    # sku - (Required) An SKU block as described below.
    sku = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.   Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Key Vault resource. Changing this   forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # enabled_for_deployment - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure Virtual   Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key   vault. Defaults to false.
    enabled_for_deployment = ""

    # enabled_for_disk_encryption - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure   Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.   Defaults to false.
    enabled_for_disk_encryption = ""

    # enabled_for_template_deployment - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether   Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.   Defaults to false.
    enabled_for_template_deployment = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # sku - (Optional) `sku` supports the following:
    sku = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # access_policy - (Optional) `access_policy` supports the following:
    access_policy = ""

    # application_id - (Optional) The object ID of an Application in Azure Active Directory.
    application_id = ""

    # certificate_permissions - (Optional) List of certificate permissions, must be one or more from   the following: `create`, `delete`, `deleteissuers`, `get`, `getissuers`, `import`, `list`, `listissuers`, `managecontacts`, `manageissuers`, `purge`, `recover`, `setissuers` and `update`.
    certificate_permissions = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Vault ID.
    # "secret_permissions" - (Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more   from the following: "backup", "delete", "get", "list", "purge", "recover", "restore" and "set".
    # "vault_uri" - The URI of the vault for performing operations on keys and secrets.
    # "secret_permissions" - (Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more   from the following: "backup", "delete", "get", "list", "purge", "recover", "restore" and "set".
}

azurerm-resource-loadbalancer.body:
resource "azurerm_lb" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the frontend ip configuration.

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.

azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-nat-pool.body:
resource "azurerm_lb_nat_pool" "$1" {
    # backend_port - (Required) The port used for the internal endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.
    backend_port = ""

    # frontend_port_end - (Required) The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.
    frontend_port_end = ""

    # frontend_port_start - (Required) The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with this Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.
    frontend_port_start = ""

    # protocol - (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp` or `Tcp`.
    protocol = ""

    # frontend_ip_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration exposing this rule.
    frontend_ip_configuration_name = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the NAT pool.
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the NAT pool.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the LoadBalancer to which the resource is attached.
}
azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-nat-pool.description: Create a LoadBalancer NAT pool. ~> **NOTE** When using this resource, the LoadBalancer needs to have a FrontEnd IP Configuration Attached

azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-nat-rule.body:
resource "azurerm_lb_nat_rule" "$1" {
    # backend_port - (Required) The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.
    backend_port = ""

    # frontend_port - (Required) The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each Rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.
    frontend_port = ""

    # protocol - (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp` or `Tcp`.
    protocol = ""

    # frontend_ip_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration exposing this rule.
    frontend_ip_configuration_name = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the NAT Rule.
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the NAT Rule.
    name = ""

    # enable_floating_ip - (Optional) Enables the Floating IP Capacity, required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group.
    enable_floating_ip = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the LoadBalancer to which the resource is attached.
}
azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-nat-rule.description: Create a LoadBalancer NAT Rule. ~> **NOTE** When using this resource, the LoadBalancer needs to have a FrontEnd IP Configuration Attached

azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-probe.body:
resource "azurerm_lb_probe" "$1" {
    # port - (Required) Port on which the Probe queries the backend endpoint. Possible values range from 1 to 65535, inclusive.
    port = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the NAT Rule.
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Probe.
    name = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) Specifies the protocol of the end point. Possible values are `Http` or `Tcp`. If Tcp is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If Http is specified, a 200 OK response from the specified URI is required for the probe to be successful.
    protocol = ""

    # request_path - (Optional) The URI used for requesting health status from the backend endpoint. Required if protocol is set to Http. Otherwise, it is not allowed.
    request_path = ""

    # interval_in_seconds - (Optional) The interval, in seconds between probes to the backend endpoint for health status. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.
    interval_in_seconds = ""

    # number_of_probes - (Optional) The number of failed probe attempts after which the backend endpoint is removed from rotation. The default value is 2. NumberOfProbes multiplied by intervalInSeconds value must be greater or equal to 10.Endpoints are returned to rotation when at least one probe is successful.
    number_of_probes = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the LoadBalancer to which the resource is attached.
}
azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-probe.description: Create a LoadBalancer Probe Resource. ~> **NOTE** When using this resource, the LoadBalancer needs to have a FrontEnd IP Configuration Attached

azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-rule.body:
resource "azurerm_lb_rule" "$1" {
    # backend_port - (Required) The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.
    backend_port = ""

    # frontend_port - (Required) The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each Rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.
    frontend_port = ""

    # protocol - (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp` or `Tcp`.
    protocol = ""

    # frontend_ip_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the frontend IP configuration to which the rule is associated.
    frontend_ip_configuration_name = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Required) The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the Rule.
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the LB Rule.
    name = ""

    # backend_address_pool_id - (Optional) A reference to a Backend Address Pool over which this Load Balancing Rule operates.
    backend_address_pool_id = ""

    # probe_id - (Optional) A reference to a Probe used by this Load Balancing Rule.
    probe_id = ""

    # enable_floating_ip - (Optional) Floating IP is pertinent to failover scenarios: a "floating” IP is reassigned to a secondary server in case the primary server fails. Floating IP is required for SQL AlwaysOn.
    enable_floating_ip = ""

    # idle_timeout_in_minutes - (Optional) Specifies the timeout for the Tcp idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to Tcp.
    idle_timeout_in_minutes = ""

    # load_distribution - (Optional) Specifies the load balancing distribution type to be used by the Load Balancer. Possible values are: Default – The load balancer is configured to use a 5 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. SourceIP – The load balancer is configured to use a 2 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers. SourceIPProtocol – The load balancer is configured to use a 3 tuple hash to map traffic to available servers.
    load_distribution = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the LoadBalancer to which the resource is attached.
}
azurerm-resource-loadbalancer-rule.description: Create a LoadBalancer Rule. ~> **NOTE** When using this resource, the LoadBalancer needs to have a FrontEnd IP Configuration Attached

azurerm-resource-network-express-route-c.body:
resource "azurerm_express_route_circuit" "$1" {
    # family - (Required) The billing mode. Value must be either "MeteredData" or "UnlimitedData".  Once you set the billing model to "UnlimitedData", you will not be able to switch to "MeteredData".
    family = ""

    # tier - (Required) The service tier. Value must be either "Premium" or "Standard".
    tier = ""

    # sku - (Required) Chosen SKU of ExpressRoute circuit as documented below.
    sku = ""

    # bandwidth_in_mbps - (Required) The bandwidth in Mbps of the circuit being created. Once you increase your bandwidth,   you will not be able to decrease it to its previous value.
    bandwidth_in_mbps = ""

    # peering_location - (Required) The name of the peering location and not the ARM resource location.
    peering_location = ""

    # service_provider_name - (Required) The name of the ExpressRoute Service Provider.
    service_provider_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.   Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the ExpressRoute circuit. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # allow_classic_operations - (Optional) Allow the circuit to interact with classic (RDFE) resources.   The default value is false.
    allow_classic_operations = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # sku - (Optional) `sku` supports the following:
    sku = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Resource ID of the ExpressRoute circuit.
    # "family" - (Required) The billing mode. Value must be either "MeteredData" or "UnlimitedData".  Once you set the billing model to "UnlimitedData", you will not be able to switch to "MeteredData".
    # "service_provider_provisioning_state" - The ExpressRoute circuit provisioning state from your chosen service provider.
    # "family" - (Required) The billing mode. Value must be either "MeteredData" or "UnlimitedData".  Once you set the billing model to "UnlimitedData", you will not be able to switch to "MeteredData".
    # "service_key" - The string needed by the service provider to provision the ExpressRoute circuit.
    # "family" - (Required) The billing mode. Value must be either "MeteredData" or "UnlimitedData".  Once you set the billing model to "UnlimitedData", you will not be able to switch to "MeteredData".
}

azurerm-resource-network-interface.body:
resource "azure_network_interface" "$1" {
    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Required) Defines how a private IP address is assigned. Options are Static or Dynamic.
    private_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # subnet_id - (Required) Reference to a subnet in which this NIC has been created.
    subnet_id = ""

    # name - (Required) User-defined name of the IP.
    name = ""

    # ip_configuration - (Required) One or more `ip_configuration` associated with this NIC as documented below.
    ip_configuration = ""

    # location - (Required) The location/region where the network interface is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the network interface. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the network interface. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # network_security_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Network Security Group to associate with the network interface.
    network_security_group_id = ""

    # internal_dns_name_label - (Optional) Relative DNS name for this NIC used for internal communications between VMs in the same VNet
    internal_dns_name_label = ""

    # enable_ip_forwarding - (Optional) Enables IP Forwarding on the NIC. Defaults to `false`.
    enable_ip_forwarding = ""

    # dns_servers - (Optional) List of DNS servers IP addresses to use for this NIC, overrides the VNet-level server list
    dns_servers = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # private_ip_address - (Optional) Static IP Address.
    private_ip_address = ""

    # public_ip_address_id - (Optional) Reference to a Public IP Address to associate with this NIC
    public_ip_address_id = ""

    # load_balancer_backend_address_pools_ids - (Optional) List of Load Balancer Backend Address Pool IDs references to which this NIC belongs
    load_balancer_backend_address_pools_ids = ""

    # load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids - (Optional) List of Load Balancer Inbound Nat Rules IDs involving this NIC
    load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids = ""

    # primary - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to `true` this should be the first `ip_configuration` in the array.
    primary = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Virtual Network Interface ID.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "mac_address" - The media access control (MAC) address of the network interface.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "private_ip_address" - The private ip address of the network interface.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "virtual_machine_id" - Reference to a VM with which this NIC has been associated.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "applied_dns_servers" - If the VM that uses this NIC is part of an Availability Set, then this list will have the union of all DNS servers from all NICs that are part of the Availability Set
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "internal_fqdn" - Fully qualified DNS name supporting internal communications between VMs in the same VNet
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
}
azurerm-resource-network-interface.description: Manages a Network Interface located in a Virtual Network, usually attached to a Virtual Machine.

azurerm-resource-network-local-network-g.body:

azurerm-resource-network-public-ip.body:
resource "azurerm_public_ip" "$1" {
    # public_ip_address_allocation - (Required) Defines whether the IP address is stable or dynamic. Options are Static or Dynamic.
    public_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the public ip.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Public IP resource . Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # idle_timeout_in_minutes - (Optional) Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes.
    idle_timeout_in_minutes = ""

    # domain_name_label - (Optional) Label for the Domain Name. Will be used to make up the FQDN.  If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.
    domain_name_label = ""

    # reverse_fqdn - (Optional) A fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
    reverse_fqdn = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Public IP ID.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "ip_address" - The IP address value that was allocated.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "fqdn" - Fully qualified domain name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
}

azurerm-resource-network-route-table.body:
resource "azurerm_route_table" "$1" {
    # next_hop_type - (Required) The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to. Possible values are `VirtualNetworkGateway`, `VnetLocal`, `Internet`, `VirtualAppliance` and `None`.

    address_prefix = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the route.

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the route table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the route table. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # route - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to define multiple routes. Each `route` block supports fields documented below.
    route = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # next_hop_in_ip_address - (Optional) Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is `VirtualAppliance`.
    next_hop_in_ip_address = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Route Table ID.
    # "next_hop_in_ip_address" - (Optional) Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is "VirtualAppliance".
    # "subnets" - The collection of Subnets associated with this route table.
    # "next_hop_in_ip_address" - (Optional) Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is "VirtualAppliance".
}
